name: Collins Community Credit Union
summary: Aspire. Ignite. Achieve.
description:
What started in 1940 by ten Collins Radio Employees has grown to be one of the largest credit unions in the state of Iowa with over $1 billion in assets, nearly 300 employees, and branches in Cedar Falls, Dubuque, Cedar Rapids, North Liberty, Iowa City, and Des Moines. 

At Collins, our vision is to ignite the financial futures of our employees, members, and the communities we serve. To bring our vision to life, we have cultural values and behaviors that define our purpose, inspire our success, and encourage us to connect on a human level. These values are people, wellness, growth, community, and fun. We celebrate the unique differences of our team, promote collaborative thinking, and foster community inside and outside of our organization. 

Collins Community Credit Union Core Values:

Progressive:  We value progressive ideas that help drive positive change and transform the financial industry.

Inclusive: We know our differences are what make us unique. That’s why we strive to create an inclusive environment that makes employees and members feel safe and welcome.

Advocacy: We’re passionate about advocacy. Whether you’re advocating for yourself, your member, or the movement, we encourage you to use your voice for good.

Heart: Heart is at the core of everything we do. We value the passion, kindness, courage, and understanding our team brings to the organization each day. Our heart allows us to connect with our co-workers and membership on a human level.

Advancement: We strive to advance our organization and work toward progress and growth to ensure we’re providing our employees and members with the best products, services, and experience.

To learn more about Collins, and to view open positions, visit our website www.collinscu.org/careers.

Federally insured by NCUA.  Equal Housing Opportunity. Equal Opportunity Employer. 2017 Top Workplace. 2018 Top Workplace.
specialties: Banking, Finance, Teamwork, Collaboration, Growth, Community, Consumer Lending, Mortgage Lending, and Commercial Lending

Congratulations to our Vice President of Retail, Lindsey Dozier, on being recognized as one of this year’s Forty Under 40 honorees in the Corridor Business Journal! The Forty Under 40 Awards recognize 40 leaders under the age of 40 who have made a significant impact in their business and community early in their careers.
 
While we could discuss Lindsey’s accomplishments at length, her most recent is launching our new youth community space called The Hub. Throughout the past two years, Lindsey has led the development of The Hub, which provides free after-school programming to area middle schoolers. Lindsey brought The Hub from a vision to reality, spending countless hours partnering with organizations and non-profits to provide critical resources surrounding education, music, arts, wellness, physical and mental well-being, and more at The Hub. It’s a fun, vibrant space for kids to learn, play, and connect with one another. You can read more about her work and The Hub here: https://lnkd.in/enKAQgqr. 
 
Lindsey embodies our "people helping people" philosophy and her achievements have truly reached far beyond the financial world. She is already onto new fun and exciting ways to continue engaging with our youth…which we can’t wait to share soon.
 
Thank you, Lindsey, for everything you do for our organization, our members, and our community! See the full list of honorees here: https://bit.ly/3Br33ua.

It’s official! 🎉 Last week we celebrated the Grand Opening and Ribbon Cutting of our new 1st Avenue branch! 

Thank you to everyone who attended and made this such a special night for our team. We look forward to sharing more fun and exciting moments with the community in our new space so soon, including our Juneteenth After Party coming up on June 26! Click here to learn more about our Juneteenth event: https://bit.ly/3aXMoDL.

Yesterday was such a big day for the future of Collins Community Credit Union! We celebrated the official groundbreaking at the site of our NEW Dubuque branch, to be located at 255 John F. Kennedy Road. 

Thank you to the Dubuque Area Chamber of Commerce, Greater Dubuque Development Corp., and all of our members, employees, and partners who joined us for this milestone. We can’t wait to expand our impact in the area and better serve our Dubuque members and the community for years to come. ✨💙

name: Headline Solar
summary: Fastest Growing Solar Company in the Midwest and Texas. Solar Made Simple™
description:
Headline Solar is the fastest-growing solar company in Illinois and Texas. Our goal is to help people save money on electricity, become resilient from the utility, and create a positive environmental impact. Founded in late 2018, our HQ is in Hoffman Estates, IL, and serves all of Illinois and all of Texas. We are a solar panel sales, service, and installation company that is fully vertically integrated. We hold over 25 years of combined experience and specialize in installing photovoltaic panels for residential homes and commercial buildings.

Our unique value proposition is have our core foundation revolve around a customer-centric approach while offering competitive rates without compromising customer satisfaction or quality

Our mission is to provide homeowners and business owners with access to reliable solar power at an affordable price while helping them save money on their electric bills, become resilient from the utility, and protect our planet.
specialties: Solar Energy, Marketing, Sales, Solar, and Renewable Energy

posts.text:
In August 2022, the Inflation Reduction Act passed, increasing the solar tax credit to 30% of the system cost—which can include a battery!

As of December 1, 2022, Duke Energy Progress has raised their rates to $0.129 per kWh (after tax). This is a 9.3% increase in energy costs, compared to their 4% average increase in past decades. If you don’t buy electricity from Duke Energy, you can still expect to see increases in energy costs with other utility companies.
#solarenergy #gosolar #headlinesolar

The Illinois Solar Rebate Makes Solar Affordable Again!

If you're looking to have solar panels installed on your home, then it may be time to look into the Illinois Solar Rebate. This rebate is a great way for homeowners in Illinois to get solar panels at an affordable price while also being able to take advantage of the benefits that come with owning solar panels. One of these benefits is not having to worry about high electricity bills anymore, because once you purchase and install solar panels on your property, you will cut down on how much money you spend each month on energy costs.

Although most people think that Chicagoland doesn't have enough sun, there is more than enough sun in the summer to make up for the very dark winters. In addition, the UV rays that come through the clouds are also used by solar panels to generate energy.

This means that even if you live in one of the coldest places in Illinois, solar panels can still save you a lot of money on your electricity bills.

For more information about installing solar panels on your property to reduce costs while also lowering our dependence on traditional energy sources like coal and natural gas, head over to our website!

#illinoissolar #solarrebate #solarenergy

Cost savings: A solar electric system provides an opportunity for anyone who is looking to reduce monthly utility bills and make a long-term, low-risk investment.

Increased home value: Solar panels are viewed as upgrades, like a renovated kitchen or a finished basement, so purchasing a solar energy system will likely increase your home’s value. Studies show that homeowners pay a premium for a solar home; one study by Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory showed that on average, solar increased the value of a home by about $15,000. 

Solar works everywhere: Most states in the United States have good-to-excellent solar resource. Even places with relatively low solar resources, such as the Pacific Northwest and Alaska, can experience cost savings, and have similar solar resources to countries that have widely developed solar PV, like Germany.

Environmental: Each kilowatt-hour (kWh) of solar that is generated will substantially reduce greenhouse gas emissions like CO2, as well as other dangerous pollutants such as sulfur oxides, nitrogen oxides and particulate matter. Solar also reduces water consumption and withdrawal.

#benefitsofsolar #gosolar #gogreen #solarenergy

U.S. power generation from new renewables capacity-mostly wind and solar-will reduce generation from both coal-fired and natural gas-fired power plants in 2023 and 2024. 

One of the most significant shifts in the mix of U.S. electricity generation over the past few years has been the rapid expansion of renewable energy resources, especially solar and wind. The U.S. electric power sector operated about 74 gigawatts (GW) of solar photovoltaic capacity at the end of 2022, which is about three times the capacity at the end of 2017. U.S. wind power has grown by more than 60% since 2017 to about 143 GW of capacity.
#renewableenergy #solar #powergeneration

Solar space news while you're enjoying your St. Patrick's Day!

NASA's Parker Solar Probe makes its 15th close flyby of the sun this St. Patrick's Day. This solar probe is the first-ever mission to "touch" the Sun. The spacecraft is about the size of a car and travels directly through the Sun's atmosphere. This spacecraft will get to the high temperature of 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit. This Delta IV- Heavy rocket launched on August 12, 2018. According to NASA's Parker Solar Probe website, the exact time of the close approach will be 4:30pm when the spacecraft comes within 5.3 million miles of the sun's surface.

#happystpatricksday #parkersolarprobe #solarnews #funfactfriday

The future for renewable energy is looking brighter than ever. By 2024, it is estimated that 33% of the world's electricity will be from solar. More people are making the switch to solar due to renewable energy, costs have dropped, increasing home value, tax breaks and incentives. Solar for your home is now more affordable, accessible, and efficient than ever before. The future of energy is looking greener.

#2024 #solarenergy #renewableenergy #futureofsolar

Three interesting solar facts:

1. You don't have to buy solar panels outright.
2. Solar energy is becoming more affordable.
3. Solar power is the third most-used renewable energy source.

#headlinesolar #gosolar #gogreen

We pride ourselves in being customer centric. Your satisfaction is our highest priority. In practical terms that means we don’t just focus on trying to sell you a system and then disappear. We focus instead on providing a solution that will fit your specific needs perfectly, in the most affordable fashion! Here is what our customer Robert Crook has to say:

Why should you care about making your home more energy efficient? Increased efficiency can lower greenhouse gas emissions and other pollutants, as well as decrease water use. It can benefit the economy by lowering individual utility bills, creating jobs, and helping stabilize electricity prices and volatility.

#energyefficiency #headlinesolar #gogreen

Fun Fact Friday!

Did you know the Greeks and Romans were the first to use passive solar designs? Buildings with south facing windows allowed the sun to heat and light indoor spaces.

#passivesolarhistory #funfactfriday #gosolar

name: Tephra Labs
summary: Technology for large-scale human coordination
description:
Governments and companies have failed to move the needle against many of humanity’s most important challenges and opportunities. We need new organizational structures. At Tephra Labs, we believe that decentralized human networks have the potential to be the right meta-coordinating structures for these large-scale problems. These networks can engage diverse participants and grow to unprecedented sizes (hundreds of millions of people). Further, they do not rely on the same kind of centralized direction-setting that is characteristic of governments and companies – making them lower overhead organizational structures overall.

Tephra Labs’ mission is to enable large-scale human coordination to address humanity’s most important challenges and opportunities. We aim to build the infrastructure to scale decentralized networks to billions of people, and to support network participants in leading consistent, purposeful, and fulfilling lives. Our hypothesis is that hyper-scale decentralized networks will grow by engaging people as independent workers, rather than employees. So, we are building the necessary products, tooling, and services to help independent workers thrive.

Our first product is Radius (https://radius.space). Radius is a decentralized network that connects independent workers and teams to the best projects in web3. As part of the Radius project, we are building decentralized reputation systems, skills attestation protocols, and a user-owned and value accretive economy. In accordance with our mission, we will also build educational curricula and programs to help train Radius workers and onboard them successfully into web3 work opportunities.

We are excited to build the necessary infrastructure to enable the first billion-person organizations in human history. If this mission also inspires you, consider joining us.

name: Oxford Properties Group
description:
We are a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and builder of businesses and teams. We build, buy and grow defined real estate operating businesses with world-class management teams. Together with our portfolio companies, we manage over $86 billion of assets across four continents.

Our collective portfolio includes office, industrial and logistics, multi-family residential, life sciences, retail, data centers, hotels and credit investments. Oxford was established in 1960 and is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees.

A warm welcome to Tina Pristovsek who joins Oxford as Vice President, Real Estate Finance & Capital Markets - Europe. Based in London, Tina will manage our €3 billion European debt portfolio, and build and strengthen relationships with global lending partners.

We sat down with Tina to learn more about her 👇

• Why Oxford? 
Oxford are a forward-thinking and innovative investor and I am thrilled to be joining this dynamic and collaborative global family.  

• What are you excited to dig into and work on first?
I look forward to bolstering our key European lender strategic relationships - a critical driver of success - to allow Oxford to navigate the volatile credit environment. 

• What is your proudest accomplishment? 
There is no single one. Each and every small win are a building block for the next. 

• If you could choose anything to do for a day, what would it be?
If I could, I would learn a handful of new languages - that would open up a whole new world of possibilities that would take me beyond that one day.

• Do you have a motto or words you live by?
Good decisions come from experience, and experience comes from bad decisions.

Welcome to the team, Tina!

We are proud to announce Allison Wolfe, CFO & Global Head of Portfolio Management is being honoured with The Globe and Mail's Report on Business Best Executive Award.

During her 13 years at Oxford, Allison has set herself apart with an unflinching commitment to problem solving. name: Toronto Parking Authority
description: The Toronto Parking Authority (TPA) is a City agency which operates municipal on-street metered parking and off-street parking facilities in Toronto. The TPA’s Bike Share program (Bike Share Toronto) provides bicycle rentals on a short-term basis throughout Toronto.

posts.text:
Mayor John Tory has officially opened the #electricvehicle  charging station at the #GreenP parking garage at 11 Wellesley Street West.

With 8 electric vehicle chargers, this new block of chargers is a small part of our EV network, which will expand to over 100 #EV chargers in the coming weeks.

"This EV initiative is another example of the progress we are making moving our city forward and working on solutions to achieve our Net Zero emission goals," said Toronto Mayor John Tory. "We are working hard as a City government to tackle climate change at the local level, and we have a lot more work to do. With all our City partners, including the Toronto Parking Authority, working together, we will get there."

TPA and Mayor John Tory officially launched the new EV charging initiative at an event attended by Deputy Mayor Jennifer McKelvie, Ward 13 City Councilor Chris Moise, TPA President Scott Collier and Executive Director of the City’s Environment & Climate Division James Nowlan.

“As demand for electric vehicle charging continues to grow, current and future EV owners expect a charging network that offers speed, choice, and ease of use,” said TPA President Scott Collier. “As the largest municipally-owned commercial parking operator in North America we have a tremendous opportunity to leverage our GreenP parking locations both off-street and on-street to help drive EV adoption” 

By the end of 2024, TPA expects to operate an EV charging network consisting of over 650 EV chargers that will be found in Green P locations (garages, lots and on-street). 

Working together with our partners at Toronto Hydro, the City’s Transportation Services Division, The Atmospheric Fund (TAF) Fund, and the City’s Environment and Climate Division, TPA looks forward to collaborating with existing and future partners as we continue to build and scale the EV charging network.

Watch this space for more details!

Our new station at Victoria Park & Kingston Rd is ready to enjoy!
Just installed last week, the Victoria Park & Kingston Rd bike share station is one of 10 Bike Share installations planned for Southwestern Scarborough.

This is only a small part of our 2022 expansion plans, which aim to have up to 40 bike share stations installed throughout Toronto - including new stations in Thorncliffe Park, Flemingdon Park, and Jane & Finch.

These new stations bring us one step closer to our long-term goal of ensuring all 25 of Toronto’s Wards have access to Bike Share Toronto by 2025.

But we’re not stopping there - by 2025, we plan to expand our (ever growing) network from 625 stations & 7,165 bikes to over 1,000 stations & 10,000 bikes!
 
 Watch this space for details, and come along for the ride! Read the full plan here  https://lnkd.in/dR8rQUQU

Tomorrow afternoon, Justin Hanna will take the stage at the global NABSA conference to discuss the future of Bike Share Toronto. He will discuss ambitious expansion plans and how Bike Share Toronto’s customer-centric model propels it forward. #NABSA2022
North American Bikeshare & Scootershare Association

Director of Bike Share Toronto, Justin Hanna, will be speaking at the NABSA conference on October 27th. He will highlight how Bike Share has used research, data and customer insights to become an integral part of Toronto’s transportation network. 

North American Bikeshare & Scootershare Association #NABSA2022

The Toronto Parking Authority is thrilled to announce that it has released an Expression of Interest for a corporate partner for its popular Bike Share Toronto program.

We are reimagining how Toronto moves with an invitation to the business community to join us on our journey at creating the future of sustainable mobility for our city. 

This is a great opportunity for a win-win partnership and we look forward to speaking with prospective companies soon.

If you are interested in learning more, please send us a DM and we will be in touch.

Great News! The TPA enforcement team is very excited to announce the launch of the Toronto Gtechna electronic printing module. This module adds a waist-mounted printer to provide quick and easy data capture and information transfer to the TPA ticketing system. Additionally, the printers eliminate handwritten parking violation notices (PVN) and provide PVN printing on the spot, simplifying and streamlining the process. This technological advancement will increase productivity and allow officers to be more active across our facilities. 
The addition of this technology will also improve customer experience by providing consistent and clear infraction notices and will align with the technology used by Toronto Police Services. 
Another step towards a renewed mission and vision at the Toronto Parking Authority!

We are proudly partnering with City of Toronto and Purolator Inc. to launch an Urban Quick Stop pilot program. This new mini hub shipping container is conveniently located in our Green P parking lot at 19 Spadina Rd. Torontonians can easily pick up and deliver packages as they go about their daily activities. This innovative solution is a sustainable approach to shipping, introducing environmentally friendly e-bikes to reduce truck deliveries in the community – decreasing traffic congestion and CO2 emissions. 

Thanks Mayor John Tory, Toronto Councillor Mike Layton, City of Toronto Transportation Services Barbara Gray for being a part of our kick-off event. 

Learn more: https://lnkd.in/gkq4C7u5

We are proud to share our 2021 Annual Report themed, ‘Our Customer-centric Journey Towards Sustainable Mobility’. With a renewed mission, vision, and a strengthened strategic framework, the foundation is set to meet the evolving needs of our customers. Some of the highlights from last year’s accomplishments include generating $93M in revenues, Bike Share Toronto reaching record ridership of 3.5M rides, and 10.1M mobile pay transactions through the Green P app. We developed a 4-year Bike Share Toronto growth plan and launched a multi-year EV charging initiative, as we aim to be a catalyst for electrification and growth in Toronto’s mobility network.

https://lnkd.in/gEmnz3uC
#greenpparking #bikesharetoronto #cityoftoronto #torontomobility #torontotransportation #torontomicromobility #EVcharging #ebikes

name: Humana
description: At Humana, our cultural foundation is aligned to helping members achieve their best health by delivering personalized, simplified, whole-person healthcare experiences. Recognizing healthcare needs continue to evolve for each person, for each family and for each community, Humana continuously creates innovative solutions and resources that help people live their healthiest lives on their terms –when and where they need it. Our employees are at the heart of making this happen and that’s why we are dedicated to building an organization of dynamic talent whose experience and passion center on putting the customer first.

posts.text: We want you to experience all the things that bring you joy. That’s why, during #WorldImmunizationWeek, it’s a good idea to talk to your doctor about recommended vaccinations against diseases such as the flu and shingles. Vaccinations aren’t just for kids. Adults need them too. Stay up to date and continue enjoying life on your terms. Don’t miss a moment with family and friends.

Our senior members enjoy exploring tasty food and we enjoy offering nutritious recipes to support whole-person health. The Humana Neighborhood Center website is a one-stop-shop to find new ideas and healthy alternatives to dishes you love, plus so much more. 

View our latest Kitchen Creation by Chef Nino—black bean and mango pico de gallo—and explore all that the Humana Neighborhood Center has to offer online. https://huma.na/3n251wt
#HumanaNeighborhoodCenter #HealthyFood #CookingDemo

At Humana we aim to support our lifelong well-being strategy by ensuring that we are doing our part to take on climate change, pollution and other environmental factors that impact our health. Some of the ways we have done this over the last year include:

🌱 Recycling 145 tons of surplus office furniture, equipment and supplies, including donating to local organizations across the countries and to communities impacted by natural disasters

🌳 Reducing our greenhouse gas emissions by 35% and achieving a waste diversion of 64%

🖨 Reducing waste in the materials we send to our customers and in our Humana Neighborhood Centers with a goal to save $5 million by the end of 2023

💡 Continuing to replace all lights in our owned and leased facilities to reach ENERGY STAR certification in each of those locations 

Learn more about our sustainability practices and commitment to the health of our environment → https://huma.na/3H4eQkB

Through our commitments to wellbeing and work-life balance, we support each employee’s personal health, purpose, work style, sense of belonging, and security.

“It’s just fun for me to see people's smiles when you make their day.  They have all kinds of ways to support their employees that want to give back and want to volunteer. If there's a will, there's a way, and Humana has found it,” says Anne Marie Torres. 

Learn more about how Humana employees Leslie and Anne Marie feel valued in their community and at work → https://huma.na/41k4xRg
#TeamHumana #NationalVolunteerMonth

Our Medicaid health plan—Humana Healthy Horizons—is committed to providing services to help our members live their best lives. “I’m grateful to play a part in delivering holistic care to our members,” said Andrew Renda, Vice President, Population Health, Humana Healthy Horizons. “We aim to improve access to care, address social needs and health disparities, and ultimately improve health outcomes for people who are physically, socially or economically disadvantaged.”

Kimberly McElroy, Chief Operating Officer, Humana Healthy Horizons in South Carolina said, “We deliver integrated care strategies to promote improved health outcomes, member & provider experiences and make a valuable contribution to the healthcare goals of South Carolina.” Learn more about how we support the whole-person health of our Medicaid members → https://huma.na/3ZZxikS
#MedicaidAwarenessMonth #HealthEquity

Al Hernandez, MBA, Regional Vice President – Southeast, immigrated to the United States from Cuba when he was a teenager. He joined the health care industry because he wanted to make a difference and believes that the health benefits that we are putting in the marketplace are doing just that.  

Learn more about Al, how he feels Humana has evolved to better serve our customers and communities, and how his work ethic and upbringing have impacted his career → https://huma.na/417Rpyt

Autism spectrum disorder (also called ASD or autism) is a neurological and developmental condition that can affect someone's social skills, sensory processing and self-regulation. 

All too often, autistic individuals aren't given the support they deserve. But we believe in a world where everyone has what they need to live their healthiest, fullest life, and we're working to make it happen—for the autism community, caregivers and everyone with a disability.

This Autism Acceptance Month, we encourage you to look for ways you can be a better ally to those with autism in your workplace. Learn more about allyship and inclusion → https://huma.na/3zTCnjU
#AutismAcceptanceMonth

Our hearts go out to those impacted by the tragic shootings in Louisville. Together with The Humana Foundation, we are making a donation to support victims and their families, as well organizations supporting community healing and mental health services in our corporate hometown.

“Monday’s news hit our Louisville family hard,” said Bruce Broussard, Humana President and CEO. “We are a close community and we are in mourning for our friends, colleagues and others who have been impacted by these tragedies. We are also humbled and grateful for the courage of the first responders who kept a bad situation from being even worse. There is a lot of healing to do.” 

Learn more → https://huma.na/41nKTDz

We’re proud to support our members like Cheryle who are caregivers. In honor of Autism Acceptance Month, here’s how Cheryle is learning to take care of herself so she can provide the best care possible for her grandson who lives with autism.

Watch Cheryle’s full story about how she takes care of herself so she can take care of her grandson → https://huma.na/3MoIPHe
#Caregivers #AutismAcceptance #CelebrateDifferences

Recognizing and celebrating what makes our employees unique is core to our mission of having and nurturing an inclusive culture. Part of this includes learning and understanding what makes our colleagues unique so that we can celebrate with each other and become better allies.  

To learn more about Ramadan, which is observed from March 22 through April 20, we spoke with Humana employee, Khursheed Zafar, MBA, Vice President, Retail Direct Marketing Sales and Operations.  

Learn more about what Ramadan is and stands for to Khursheed as well as his tips to becoming a better ally → https://huma.na/3Gihbbe

name: Bremer Whyte Brown & O'Meara, LLP
summary: Award-winning, full-service law firm that provides a range of litigation services to businesses and individuals.
description:
Bremer Whyte Brown & O’Meara, LLP (“Bremer Whyte”) is an AV-rated firm that provides a full range of transaction and litigation services to businesses and individuals. With more than 180 attorneys and offices throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, and Colorado, we take great pride as a full-service law firm committed to high-quality and responsive legal services. 

Our firm is known for its well-balanced combination of aggressive, competent litigators and negotiators, seasoned trial practitioners, and experienced transactional attorneys. Our attorneys have extensive experience in corporate law; contract negotiation and drafting; personal, product and property injury law; advertising loss; copyright and trademark infringement; family law; construction law; insurance coverage; employment law; estate planning; and, general business and personal litigation services. 

Our firm is committed to our slogan – SOLUTIONS. We believe that ethical, creative, thoughtful and tactful SOLUTIONS for each of our clients helps them meet their business, financial, and personal goals.
specialties: Construction Law, Business Law, General Liability Law , Family Law, Real Estate Law , Employment Law, Enviromental Law, and Habitational Law

posts.text:
We are honored to share that BWB&O Partner John O'Meara and Partner Nicole Whyte are featured speakers on individual panels at the Consulegis World Conference in the majestic Palma de Mallorca, Spain from Thursday, May 4- Saturday, May 6, 2023.
 
On Friday, May 5, 2023, Mr. O'Meara is speaking on a panel, Litigation: "Strategies for Successful Mediation and Client Satisfaction", alongside his international law colleagues Kazuhiko Nishihara, Honmachi International Law Office, P.C., Osaka, Japan; Robert Kay, Quastels, London, England; Gad Matalon, Lawyalty Avvocati Associati, Milano, Italy; and Moderator Tom Arndt, TWA Law, Toronto, Canada.
 
On Friday, May 5, 2023, Ms. Whyte is speaking on a panel, "Challenges of Hiring and Retaining Young Talent: What are They Expecting?", alongside her international law colleagues Gethin Bennet, Royal Mint, Wales, United Kingdom; Alex Christen, Capital Law, Cardiff, United Kingdom; Brian Kahn, Bran Kahn Firm, South Africa; and Moderator Judd Cohen, Meister Seelig and Fein PLLC, New York, New York.  
 
A special thank you to Dr. Frühbeck Abogados S.L.P. for hosting the 2023 World Conference of Consulegis!

BWB&O is a proud member of CONSULEGIS, one of the oldest and strongest international networks of quality independent law firms, accountants, in-house lawyers, and related professional advisors firms. Consulegis promotes the building of strong and close relationships, referrals and networking opportunities, which allows mid-sized law firms and other advisory professional firms worldwide to work together. The network has grown to become a premier association, which comprises more than 1,300 lawyers in over 35 countries and 100 cities - and is still growing!

Partners John O'Meara from Woodland Hills, Vik Nagpal from San Diego, and Jeremy Johnson from Newport Beach visited the Colorado team this week. They enjoyed seeing the new Denver office and connecting with the team over lunch. 

Conor McElligott

Please join BWB&O's Las Vegas Partner Devin Gifford, and industry peers Pete Fowler, Don Gifford, and Fernanda Aragon for a FREE webinar on Thursday, April 27th at 10:00 AM PST.
 
Register here: https://lnkd.in/gSVX-3ta

BWB&O is excited to share that Newport Beach Senior Associate Kyle Riddles and Associate Alexandria Heins, Esq. obtained a significant trial victory on behalf of their client in a multi-million dollar dispute stemming from the construction of a commercial expansion project at a beachfront resort.
 
The owner of the resort alleged that the general contractor was responsible for a significant delay to the completion of the expansion project. The general contractor filed a cross-complaint against BWB&O’s client in an attempt to pass through the delay claims to BWB&O's client. The general contractor’s delay expert alleged a total 441 days of delay to the completion of the project. A significant portion of the delay was apportioned to BWB&O’s client, for which it faced substantial contractual damages. Senior Associate Kyle Riddles expertly crossed key witnesses and obtained testimony that was extremely favorable to its client.
 
Upon conclusion of the general contractor’s case-in-chief, and after over two weeks of trial, BWB&O moved for judgment following the lack of admitted evidence substantiating the general contractor’s claims. The Judge agreed with the arguments presented by BWB&O and granted the motion for judgment, resulting in a win for BWB&O's client!

Congratulations to BWB&O Partner Eileen Gaisford and Associate Kelsey Kohnen for successfully arguing and winning a Motion for Terminating Sanctions for BWB&O’s client, a hotel in Los Angeles County. The court granted BWB&O’s Motion for Terminating Sanctions and Plaintiff’s Complaint was dismissed with prejudice.
 
Plaintiff filed a complaint alleging she sustained multiple injuries after a slip and fall in a hotel. Plaintiff’s complaint alleged that BWB&O’s client was negligent, careless, and reckless in the ownership, care, control, and maintenance of the premises. BWB&O aggressively defended its client and filed several motions, arguing Plaintiff’s conduct abused the discovery process. The Court sided with BWB&O and granted its Motion for Terminating Sanctions, and the lawsuit was dismissed with prejudice.

Great work and congratulations again to Eileen and Kelsey!

Oatey is based in Cleveland, Ohio, and has locations in the United States, Canada, Mexico and China. For more information, visit oatey.com or call (800) 321-9532.

name: Zoic Studios
description:
"Visual Evolution" is our mission­-to evolve the story, art, and technology of the moving image, and through this evolution, broaden the audience for moving images.

Partnership, integrity, and enthusiasm are the key founding principles at Zoic. Our projects are born in think tanks, where every idea has value and potential. Good ideas are fleshed out, and a plan for achieving a visual representation of the idea is set early in the creative process. During production we remain accountable to our word and, as changes occur, we change together. We believe that partnerships that remain intact finish with integrity. Most importantly, we love what we do.

Zoic is a company of accomplished artists and producers who understand story, process, and relationships. Our team has a proven record of success. They are masters in their fields of 3D, Compositing, and Production Management. Their reputations, in turn, attract additional talent and encourage a strong work ethic.

We have built a digital infrastructure, which is flexible and strong to support the staff. It is a "liquid" pipeline, designed by our team for rapid expansion and contraction. It is resolution- independent and changeable based on project needs. Leading visual technology firms provide additional support and insight to the latest methods. We work with these partners as we do with our creative partners: by promoting visual evolution as fast as technology allows.

What we do can seem complex and foreign--even incomprehensible. It is our intention to educate and encourage others to embrace this change and together create something new.
specialties: Visual Effects, Game Engine Technology, and Real-time animation

name: Crestline Investors, Inc.
description: Crestline Investors, Inc., founded in 1997 and based in Fort Worth, Texas, is a credit focused institutional alternative investment management firm. Crestline specializes in credit and opportunistic investments. In addition, the firm manages a multi-PM equity market-neutral hedge fund, and provides Beta and Hedging Solutions for Institutional clients. Headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas, the company maintains affiliate offices in New York City, London, Toronto and Tokyo.

posts.text:
Crestline Partner Chris Semple will join Institutional Investor's Public Funds Roundtable on April 25 to discuss “Why this cycle is different from previous ones,” focusing on how this current economic environment is different or similar to past recessions and how it will impact asset value and markets. 

Visit the link below to learn more:

We are pleased to announce that Crestline’s Fund Liquidity Solutions Group has been shortlisted for the fifth consecutive year for Fund Financier of the Year, Americas, as part of Private Debt Investor's 2022 Global Awards. 
 
These annual awards recognize top-performing fund managers, investors, as well as those working in advisory and legal roles throughout the private debt industry. 
 
We congratulate our Fund Liquidity Solutions Group colleagues as well as our fellow nominees. 
 
Don’t forget to cast your vote by January 11th, 2023 by following the link below: 
 
Vote here: https://lnkd.in/gUGhuiFk [surveymonkey.co.uk]

Crestline Partner Chris Semple will be speaking at Private Debt Investor's Seoul Forum this Tuesday, November 8, on the opening panel “Private Credit: Moving to post pandemic opportunities”. He will be joined by a group of esteemed credit professionals to discuss the state of private credit investing and the strategies that are proving to be resilient given the current economic climate. Visit the link below to learn more:

Multi-strategy hedge funds continue to make waves across the asset management industry. In a recent article published by Financial Times, author Robyn Wigglesworth explains how multi-strategy hedge funds have now eclipsed traditional standalone global macro across funds in total AUM, paving the way to become the new dominant force within the industry. 
 
Open architecture, and multi-strategy models, such as Crestline Summit Equity Alpha, are increasingly attracting top investment talent and offer a range of advantages to investors seeking a comprehensive yet differentiated solution. 
 
Follow the link below to read the full article in Financial Times and learn more:

Crestline Managing Partner & Co-CIO Keith Williams will be speaking at the Institutional Investor Private Credit Forum in Toronto on September 28, where he will be joined by an impressive roster of private credit professionals who will share their views on the current state of the credit market and the best strategies for ensuring strong risk-adjusted returns during times of uncertainty. 
 
For more information on the event, please visit the link below:

We are pleased to announce that Crestline Summit has been short-listed as part of the With Intelligence and HFM US Performance Awards in the Best Global Equity Fund – Over $1 Billion and Best Multi-Strategy Long-Term Performance categories. 
 
To be among an impressive roster of top-performing firms is a true testament to Crestline Summit’s commitment to partnership, attracting and retaining top talent, and drive to consistently generate high-quality, risk-adjusted returns for its clients. 
 
We congratulate our Crestline Summit colleagues as well as our fellow nominees.

Crestline Investors, Inc.'s Dave Philipp, CFA recently sat down with Private Funds CFO reporter Amy Carroll as part of this month’s Fund Finance Report to offer his thoughts on how our current economic environment is shaping NAV-based lending. 
 
Though market volatility continues to create uncertainty across the broader financial services landscape, we anticipate it will continue to drive NAV financing demands, as hold periods increase and portfolios require temporary liquidity solutions. 
 
Click the link below to read more and be sure to check out Dave’s full feature on the latest trends surrounding NAV-based lending:

In this month’s Private Fund CFO Fund Finance Report, Crestline Investors, Inc.'s Dave Philipp, CFA offers his thoughts on the rapid growth of fund finance tools, especially NAV-based lending. As a leader in the non-bank lender space, we aim to share more insight and transparency into the trends shaping the industry in the hopes it will inspire further creativity and adoption. 
 
Click the link below to read Dave’s full feature on the latest trends driving NAV-based lending and be sure to check out the full report:

It was a pleasure to connect with friends and colleagues at The Investment Diversity Exchange (TIDE) SPARK event last week. It was an excellent forum dedicated to building community and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion throughout the investment industry. 
 
Thank you to Grace Reyes, the TIDE team and all who attended for an impactful experience!

name: HP
description:
Our vision is to create a world where innovation drives extraordinary contributions to humanity. This vision guides everything we do, how we do it, and why we do it.

Our experienced General Manager along with a staff of project managers, project executives, estimators and field foremen works with each client to make sure that the project exceeds the client’s expectations and is done on time.

name: Ritual.co
summary: We're for restaurants and the people who love them
description:
Ritual is a social ordering app that taps networks of co-workers and colleagues for fast and easy pick up and pay at a wide variety of local restaurants and coffee shops.

With Ritual, users can mobile order and pay at all their favorite local eateries and coffee shops and have it ready to pick up when they arrive. By also uniquely giving friends and colleagues the ability to add their own food orders onto an existing order, Ritual gives customers the choice of either picking up themselves or having their food brought right to their desk. This ‘social ordering’ saves customers time and drives incremental orders for merchants. The best and busiest quick service restaurants and coffee shops in major cities across North America are using Ritual to give them a competitive, technological edge, driving profitability, and a more personalized way to connect with their customers.

Can you believe we're nearly two months into 2023 😱🤯😳

It's easy to jump back into work after the new year without pausing to reflect on how your team is doing. That's why we created a guide full of ways to elevate your company culture this year – whether the team works in-office, remotely or something in between. Here are some ways to get started: 

🥰 Invest in the amenities, technology and workspaces that keep employees safe and comfortable. Regular cleaning and sanitation, comfy furniture, food perks... you get the gist! 

🌱 Openly prioritize health and wellness to ensure employees feel supported at work. This may include openly talking about mental health and offering flexible time off. 

🎉 Start new traditions, such as hosting regular team lunches and celebrating milestones. For years we couldn’t come together to celebrate – now is the time to make up for it.

Head to our blog to download the guide: https://lnkd.in/gxh45Q4F

posts.text:
Last week Assistant County Engineer Susan Fraser, P.E., CFM, and Director of Community Resilience and Transportation Planning Dr. Patrick Mandapaka joined Harris County Precinct 4 Commissioner Lesley Briones and the Harris County Office of County Administration as they announced the funding for the Alief Street Forest tree planting project in recognition of Earth Day 2023.

As part of the Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design initiative, $2 million in American Rescue Plan Act will be used to plant 1,200 trees along 17 miles of roads in Alief. We are grateful to have been a part of this event and supporting this great cause.

On April 19, 2023, the Construction Management Association of America (CMAA) invited Assistant County Engineer Susan Fraser, P.E., CFM, to give an overview of the current state of Harris County and the key initiatives Harris County Engineering Department has in place for the future of our infrastructure and community. This was an excellent opportunity to share construction practices, initiatives, and trends from the Engineering Department. During the presentation, she discussed the County’s recently adopted safety record policy, draft standards specifications, program staffing & resources, inspector assignment tools, recent bid trends, and upcoming bid opportunities. Regardless of the project's size, scope, or complexity, we are here to help build a brighter Harris County. 

We thank CMAA for their time and invitation. 
#engineering #construction #opportunities #future

That's a wrap! 👏 
Our spring interns finished their three-month long program with the Department of Engineering this week. They presented what they learned to our leadership team, including their plans for future career endeavors.

We wish them all the very best and know they will make us proud!

County Engineer Dr. Milton Rahman, PhD, P.E.,CFM, ENV SP spoke yesterday at the "Building 4 The Future" luncheon, hosted by Harris County Precinct 4 Commissioner Lesley Briones and the Houston Hispanic Architects and Engineers, Inc. (HHAE). This event was to highlight the future of infrastructure in Precinct 4.

Dr. Rahman provided information on the 2022 Harris County Bond, partnership opportunity and other county projects. We enjoyed our time at this event and are looking forward to the growth and future of this area!

The American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) invited County Engineer Dr. Milton Rahman, PhD, P.E.,CFM, ENV SP to speak at their April Branch Meeting this week. He was able to provide an update on the state of our infrastructure, an active project overview, and our key initiatives and programs. He was also able to deliver information on the upcoming neighborhood drainage improvement projects.

We thank ASCE for this invite as we appreciate the opportunity in sharing what's on the horizon for the Harris County Engineering Department!

Today County Engineer Dr. Milton Rahman, PhD, P.E.,CFM, ENV SP and other engineering department staff members joined Commissioner Lesley Briones' Harris County Precinct 4 team at the Westfield Pines and Village groundbreaking. This is just the beginning of a subdivision drainage improvement project that is sure to make a long-term impact, after 33 structures were flooded during Hurricane Harvey.

New drainage pipes, reconstruction of driveways and street sections, the adjustment of waterlines and sanitary sewer lines, as well as a detention pond are in the plans to bring this vision to life. None of this would be possible without the hard work and partnerships of all involved. We are happy to be a part in making a difference.

County Engineer Dr. Milton Rahman, PhD, P.E.,CFM, ENV SP and other supporting staff members joined Harris County Precinct 2 Commissioner Adrian Garcia at the Vista Project groundbreaking, a Hurricane Harvey recovery project. 

After Hurricane Harvey over 30,000 people were displaced to emergency shelter and the County's homeless population began to increase. This groundbreaking is the first of four single family home development projects that will increase the amount of decent, safe and affordable housing in our community. Our group is happy to offer the support of overseeing the site grading, local road construction, sidewalks, utilities, and detention ponds. We can't wait to see the difference this makes!

The Harris County Engineering Department (HCED) partnered with Precinct 3 Commissioner Tom S. Ramsey and local stakeholders on the Timber Forest Drive Bridge project, which opened this past winter. 

The Lake Houston area is rapidly expanding and not only does this bridge help reduce traffic along West Lake Houston Parkway, it also provides a more efficient route for school buses and families. Eight-foot sidewalks also run alongside the bridge, adding an extra layer of safety for pedestrians and cyclists!

The Harris County Engineering Department (HCED) has been awarded a $2 million grant from the U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) to create a prototype flood warning system. The goal of this system is to improve transportation safety and resilience.

According to Dr. Patrick Mandapaka, HCED's director of community resilience and transportation planning, the focus of the Harris County Road Flood Warning System project is on the life-saving aspects of flood risk on roadways. This project includes innovative technologies that will spread critical information during flooding events that will enable the community to take safer alternative routes.

Congratulations to Sadou Diallo, our Credit Administration officer, who has been named an “Honors Graduate” of the 2022 Oklahoma Bankers Association Consumer Lending School.

Sadou received a plaque  that Janis Reeser, OBA director of education, presented. 
 
Sadou was selected for the Consumer Lending School honor based on his outstanding work on the school’s exam and his contributions and participation in class. He was chosen by the school’s regents, staff, faculty and students. Sadou was among the 56 students who attended the school.
The OBA Consumer Lending School, conducted annually, exposes students to significant issues consumer credit managers face. It provides a framework for examining a bank’s consumer credit programs, policies and procedures and trains employees to deal with the many laws and regulations affecting bank lending and deposit functions. The school is designed to provide an extensive body of knowledge and information on consumer lending, which can contribute to the development of lending officers.

name: Beyer Blinder Belle
description:
Founded in 1968, Beyer Blinder Belle Architects is an award-winning architecture, planning, and interiors with offices in New York City, Washington, DC, and Boston. The firm’s multi-faceted design expertise encompasses preservation, urban design, and new construction for a wide spectrum of building typologies and client sectors, including cultural, civic, educational, residential, and commercial.

We seek to develop a deep understanding of each project’s character-defining features and contexts, empowering our designers to bring creativity, place-making, and authenticity to our work—meeting the needs of current and future generations alike.
specialties: Academic and Institutional, Transportation, Residential, Interiors, Historic Preservation and Adaptive Reuse, Adaptive Reuse, Urban Design and Planning, and Graphic and Signage Design

posts.text: Artnet haș details about the The Frick Collection's relocation from the Breuer building back to its permanent Fifth Avenue home. Stay tuned for an exciting 2024!

Public Housing, Restored: The Langston Terrace Dwellings will be the topic of BBB’s Kevin Storm, AIA AICP LEED AP and Alyssa Tope, AIA at the AIA|DC DesignDC conference on May 4. They will discuss the Revitalization and Sustainability Plan for the District’s first-ever public housing project, an International Style complex completed by an African American design team in 1938 for African American families. 

At the intersection of historic preservation, affordable housing, community engagement, public life, and sustainability, this comprehensive plan is restoring Langston Terrace’s founding goals of communal social progress and improved living conditions, while layering in contemporary values of inclusion, accessibility, and net-zero climate resiliency. Don’t miss it!

#publichousing #planning #washingtondc #sustainability

Drawing on One’s Roots: BBB Partner and “giant of Washington architecture” Hany Hassan sat down with Jenine Kotob, AIA at the The American Institute of Architects (AIA) to discuss how his life experiences—from growing up in Cairo, to learning and teaching alongside his father, to acclimating to the United States, to his talent for sketching—has shaped his career and approach to design. 

“The beauty of architecture is that it isn’t about self-fulfillment,” he says: “it’s a profession that embraces the creative process for others.”

And check out his pencil sketch of Cairo!

#aia #washingtondc #architecture

Design Amidst Landmarks: Principal Jae Yu discusses the design of 200 Montague Street, a new residential building in the landmarked Borough Hall Skyscraper District in Brooklyn Heights. Watch the video to see historic predecessors that inspired the design, and how the rhythmic, articulated facade harmonizes with its neighbors.
 
“It is our modern reinterpretation of the architectural essence that was embodied in the skyscraper district.”
 
Client: Aurora Capital Associates
Video: Venture Filmworks
 
#designshort #architecture #design

Eagle + West = Awards: For remediating a former industrial site on the Brooklyn waterfront, Eagle + West received the 2023 Big Apple Brownfield Award for Open Space from the New York City Brownfield Partnership. Where once was a storage yard for construction equipment, now the community enjoys a publicly accessible, resilient, green landscape along the shore of the East River.

The project also received an Honorable Mention in the Mixed-Use category from the Precast/Prestressed Concrete Institute for its distinctive “fish-scale” precast concrete facade, as well as multiple recognitions from the Structural Engineers Association of New York for the structural system that enabled its dynamic 48-foot cantilever.

Congratulations to Langan Engineering & Environmental Services, James Corner Field Operations, Marmol Radziner, OMA, BPDL Inc., Thornton Tomasetti, DeSimone Consulting Engineering, Brookfield Properties, and the rest of the project team for the much-deserved recognitions! 

📷 Ossip van Duivenbode (1, 2) Jason O'Rear (3)

#brooklyn #architecture #sustainability #engineering

Encore, Encore! Architectural Record gives insight into the rebirth of La MaMa (link below), and the careful research and thoughtful design it takes to bring new life to a cultural icon.

📷 John Bartlestone Photography

La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club, Charcoalblue, Architectural Record
#architecture #culturalhub #newyorkcity #designinspiration #theaterrestoration

Act II: Dive into the history of La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club, and BBB’s renovation of its landmark East Village home, with The Architect’s Newspaper (linked below) and Surface (linked here: https://lnkd.in/gkUahSGR)
 
“It’s the stories that bind us,” Mary Fulham,
managing director of La MaMa, said in The Architect's Newspaper. “It’s the stories that make us understand our shared humanity. It’s not politics, god help us. We believe in the power of art.”
 
“There’s a lot of musical and performance history in the building,” Beyer Blinder Belle partner Richard Metsky said in Surface. “We wanted to carry that history forward, to create a space that enables La MaMa to remain at the forefront of experimental theatre for the next 50 years.”
 
📷 John Bartlestone Photography
 
La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club, Charcoalblue, The Architect's Newspaper, Surface Magazine

posts.text:
We have some exciting news to share! 🎉🎉
Fluentify has officially become part of Voxy, an innovative training solution that provides self-study AI-driven and group classes. This partnership is going to enable us to offer an even more comprehensive language learning solution to our clients.

At Fluentify, we have always been dedicated to providing a best-in-class live instruction experience, offering highly personalized, high-impact language training programs to corporations. By joining the Voxy team, we are excited to enhance our student experience and better serve the business objectives of our clients by offering a comprehensive, AI-driven elearning platform, which includes more than 26K lessons and over 100 industry-specific courses, along with 24/7 live group classes.

This partnership with Voxy is the perfect match in so many ways.

Both of our teams care deeply about delivering tangible results through language fluency and place a high value on personalized learning and high-quality live instruction, taking a people-first approach. Together, our offering will be comprehensive, and enable our continued growth in Europe and beyond.

We are thrilled to join forces with Voxy and are confident that this partnership will support our future growth in many ways. 

Thank you for being a part of the Fluentify community, and we can't wait to share more updates with you soon!

As supply chains continue to expand in the digital world, the more commonplace #cybercriminals and #cyberattacks will become. If that’s not scary to imagine, consider this statistic—attacks originating from the supply chain 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲𝗱 𝗯𝘆 𝟲𝟮% in 2022.

So, if these “attacks” are such a problem, how can you be prepared and protect yourself from cyberthieves?

Two of our subject matter experts, Christian Cser and Melissa Poma, from our ICAT Logistics: Detroit Agency were on-site for a client in Spain!

name: Analytic Focus, LLC
summary: Data Analytics to solve complex problems in litigation and business.
description:
Analytic Focus is a quantitative consulting firm headquartered in San Antonio, TX with offices in Washington D.C. and Birmingham, AL.  Our experts serve clients with economic, financial and statistical analyses and solutions.

Our team of experts includes Ph.D.’s and industry experts with decades of experience serving the legal, banking, finance, government, healthcare, housing, and insurance industries. We collect and analyze data to deliver solutions to complex problems. 

Solutions are fueled by model development and analysis, survey development, valuation, forecasting and econometric analysis, litigation support, sampling and extrapolation, damages calculations, bioequivalence testing and research, audit sampling and reporting, population projections and advanced statistical modeling for solutions to economic, health and finance problems.
specialties: Underwriting, Quality Control, Due Diligence, Compliance, HR Analytics & Consulting, Financial Modeling & Forecasting, Statistical Analysis, Commercial Underwriting, Research & Analytics, RIsk Management, Expert Testimony, and Litigation Analytics

posts.text:

name: Hedgeye Risk Management, LLC
summary: Our founding principles remain transparency, accountability and trust.
description:
We are pioneers in the independent investment research business and a premier online financial media company. Our non-consensus research team is committed to delivering the highest caliber investment ideas through rigorous quantitative, bottom-up and macro analysis with an emphasis on timing.

Hedgeye TV is online financial media for smart investors where we showcase our analysts' leading market and economic insights and ideas. We are committed to unwavering transparency, accountability and trust.

At our core, we are a results-driven, constantly evolving, entrepreneurial company committed to intelligent expansion. Among our backers, we include "500 Startups" – one of Silicon Valley's leading accelerators and venture funds.

posts.text: DAY ONE BEGINS TODAY! You're invited to join Hedgeye Founder & CEO Keith R. McCullough as he sits down with some of the smartest, savviest and most successful investing strategists and money managers around. Access is free and you can watch live or on-demand.

GAME ON. Our 10th "Hedgeye Investing Summit" hosted by Keith R. McCullough is available live (and on-demand) on HedgeyeTV April 18/19/20. Registration is now open. We’ve got some of the best investing guests we’ve ever had. As always, it’s 100% FREE. Click to register for access.

"The way that bulls are behaving right now epitomizes the 'mother of all bubble' behavior," Keith R. McCullough tells Daniela Cambone. "I think this ends in tears in the next three to six months... not enough people learned their lesson from the bear market in 2022," he concludes.

We’re hosting Part II of our “The Mother of All Bubbles” webcast series. At 3:00pm ET on Monday April 3rd at 3:00pm, our Financials analyst Joshua Steiner and Director of Capital Allocation David A. Salem will welcome renowned historian, author and Dean of UVA’s Darden School of Business Bob Bruner. 

Bruner, Steiner and Salem will discuss Bruner's acclaimed 2007 book, The Panic of 1907: Lessons Learned from the Market's Perfect Storm. 

This trio boasts considerable experience and intellectual horsepower. They will explore what we can learn from the Panic of 1907 and how that might inform what comes next in our current banking crises. 

Mark your calendar. Bruner is one of the world’s renowned historians on banking crises (a winning recipe alongside bright shining lights like Salem and Steiner). You’re invited to join us. It's free.
During this special HedgeyeTV webcast, six Hedgeye analysts pitch one of their high-conviction stock ideas (Long or Short) to our Risk-Manager-In-Chief Keith R. McCullough.
This is one of those webcasts that you don’t miss. You make time for it. Get FREE access live and/or on-demand: https://lnkd.in/efFCkw7Z

Our Macro/Financials analyst Joshua Steiner is one of the most knowledgeable and thoughtful people on Wall Street. Watch this thoughtful discussion with Hedgeye CEO Keith R. McCullough on “The Call” which is live/on-demand weekday mornings at 7:45am ET with our entire analyst team.

“I’m not looking for one thing,” explains Hedgeye’s Risk Manager In Chief Keith R. McCullough to people hoping the banking crisis is contained. “It’s an important question that doesn’t have an answer. All the people on TV need it to be one answer, they want it to be one answer.”

“The concern here is really on a number of fronts for our purposes,” says Hedgeye Financials analyst Josh Steiner in this clip from The Call @ Hedgeye. “One is the perception around risk contagion. Obviously, Silvergate just completely came apart at the seams – it was 90 percent crypto – but Silicon Valley running into problems on this scale is certainly notable.”

name: First Pointe Management Group
description:
Our Company is engaged in the acquisition, development, redevelopment, and asset management of real estate properties in California and the Western United States. Our team consists of uniquely qualified professionals with skills in all facets of real estate development and long-term asset stewardship.

Creation and preservation of property asset values within our investment portfolio is our ultimate goal. Our philosophy is to take a long-term business approach that adapts to changing market conditions and economic and financial factors that affect property marketing, leasing, financing, and investing decisions.

Our owners established their reputation as developers, proprietors and managers of multi-family residential properties in Southern California over 30 years ago. Building on that foundation, the Company diversified into other geographic areas and product types including business parks, mid-rise office buildings, shopping centers, self-storage facilities and luxury estate homes. The partnership continues to innovate and expand into new geographic regions and products where market opportunities exist.

All comprehensive real estate services including: acquisition analysis, financing, development, redevelopment, construction, supervision, budgeting, and asset management are provided in-house to ensure financial control, state of the art information processing, and efficiency of operations. Our reputation and financial strength allows the Company to sustain growth through the acquisition and redevelopment of diverse complex projects and seizing opportunities in changing sub-markets.

name: Absco Solutions
summary: Integration that empowers and protects!
description:
Absco Solutions is a best in class fire-life safety and security systems integrator. Its installed systems are information management platforms empowering first responders, facility managers, campus communities, corporations and a wide variety of organizations, to improve efficiency, reduce liability and improve operations and safety. Absco specializes in fire, access control systems, high definition network, video management, mass notification, and systems integration. Incorporated in 1977, it has a long history of excellent work, while upholding the ethical standards and values of its clients and community.

We focus on understanding your needs. We deliver solutions that balance technology, regulation, effectiveness, and productivity. Along with our manufacturing and software partners we offer best in class solutions for access control systems, CCTV and video management, mass notification, fire safety, and complete system integration.

Our industry experience enables us to address our clients' risk exposure, both long and short term, and mitigate that risk through proper planning. We do this by drawing upon the expertise and resources of our team members and assembled vendors. Absco’s project team has individuals with more than 30 years of experience in consulting, construction, program development, application, and commissioning experience. Absco Solutions has been doing system integration since before it was a term.

With our many years of successful project delivery, this highly skilled technical and construction management team provides insightful and reliable project-solving capability. Our team includes IT expertise, certified product experts, project management, and code experts to achieve our clients’ wide range of implementation needs. We provide value and service to a wide spectrum of clients, including private universities, large corporations, medical centers, distribution facilities, technical organizations, state facilities, and US Armed Forces.
specialties: Fire Life Safety, Integration Technology and Design, Access Control, Video Surveillance, and Intrusion Detection Systems

posts.text:
At Absco Solutions, we are firm devotees that the way to progress is the continuous turn of events and learning. As a result, we agree about the importance of asking questions.

Our CEO, Erick Slabaugh, always encourages our employees to investigate and inquire to gain a deeper knowledge of our industry and customers' needs. Understanding that no one has all the answers is a critical part of our process. By asking questions and seeking feedback from others, we can improve our solutions and grow as a team and as individuals.

We are also aware of the importance of creating an environment that allows everyone to express themselves and ask questions. By setting aside our egos,
we ensure that everyone's voice is heard and valued.
We at Absco Solutions follow Erick's example of listening and seeking feedback from others. By letting our team members voice their opinions and make decisions, we believe we can create a more innovative and successful organization.

We urge you to continue asking questions and seeking information from a diverse group. Through this process, we can all learn and grow leaders in our organizations.

#TimelessPrinciples #KnowledgeIsPower

Take a look at this great interview with our CEO, Erick, as he speaks about the struggles and rewards of building thriving businesses- that is us at Absco Solutions and FCP Insight! Erick shares some great tips for delegating and prioritizing effectively. #entrepreneurmindset #leadership #ceo

At Absco Solutions, we believe in learning and experiencing the world around us. Our CEO, Erick Slabaugh, recently shared the importance of connecting with nature and personal growth through travel. National parks are like people, unique and worth exploring. Erick just checked off number 43 on his mission to visit all the US national parks. Each park has something special to offer, from breathtaking vistas to unique geological features. Traveling with family and friends allows us to share new experiences, create memories, and appreciate nature's beauty. What's your favorite national park, and why? Share with us! #TimelessPrinciples #CoreValues

We're thrilled to share this testimonial from one of our satisfied clients, who recently worked with Absco for their project.

""I’m very satisfied with the service Absco provided. They were helpful and professional, as well as flexible and willing to push the job. The onsite guys were great to work with. I like how they worked together out in the field. We worked together to make the design intent work out. It was a success!""

At Absco, we strive to provide our clients with the best possible experience from start to finish. Thank you to our valued client for sharing their positive experience with our team!

#AbscoClientTestimonial #ClientSatisfaction #ProfessionalService #FlexibleApproach #Teamwork #DesignSuccess #CustomerExperience #HappyClients #BuildingSuccess #QualityService

Our CEO at Absco Solutions, Erick Slabaugh, has been a member of the Entrepreneurs' Organization (EO) for more than 25 years and has personally benefited from being a part of this vibrant network. He has benefited as an entrepreneur from EO's significant connections, memorable experiences, and insightful perspectives.

At Absco Solutions, we are aware of the need of having a solid support network, particularly for entrepreneurs. We're honored to be affiliated with EO, and we recommend all aspiring and seasoned business executives consider finding an amazing community like EO to belong to- the benefits are both personal and professional.

#EntrepreneursOrganization #EO #Entrepreneurship #BusinessNetworking #BusinessCommunity #SupportSystem #SuccessTips #SmallBusinessAdvice #BusinessInsights #BusinessLeadership #BusinessDevelopment #BusinessGrowth #BusinessConnections #NetworkingEvent #ProfessionalGrowth #BusinessMentorship #MentorshipProgram #BusinessResources

At Absco Solutions, our CEO, Erick Slabaugh, instills these values in all of us because he recognizes the value of unforgettable experiences and enduring connections. We are inspired to immerse ourselves in authentic experiences, look for inspiration, and form deep connections with others around us because of his leadership and direction.

It is more crucial than ever to forge real connections with one another in the modern world, where digital connections can be impersonal. Let's pause to consider our experiences and the people who have had a profound influence on our lives. We can all advance both personally and professionally by encouraging one another and building enduring relationships.

#Inspiration #TimelessPrinciples #CoreValues #Leadership #MeaningfulConnections #ProfessionalGrowth #PersonalGrowth #GuidingPrinciples #Motivation #InspiringJourneys #Reflection #GenuineConnections #Success #AbscoSolutions #ErickSlabaugh

At Absco Solutions, we believe that success is more than profits and growth - it's also about the legacy we leave behind. That's why we're passionate about building a community on timeless principles that will inspire the next generation of leaders. Our CEO, Erick Slabaugh is grateful for the past and present members of the Entrepreneurs' Organization who have helped us achieve this mission. He believes that each member on this list has a unique quality: a deep commitment to creating a better future. Let's continue to build timeless communities together.

#TimelessCommunities #CoreValues #Entrepreneurship #AbscoSolutions

At Absco, we strongly believe in the power of giving back to the community. Our CEO, Erick Slabaugh, often emphasizes the importance of serving others as a crucial leadership trait that can inspire individuals to realize their full potential.

"
K-12 security should not be left to chance. Our goal is to make our schools safe havens for our children, creating a safe, orderly, and  inviting learning environment that will help them achieve their highest potential.

A good process and system for access control is the first line of defense in keeping out threats from our schools. 

Here are some important questions to ask to assess your current system:

- Can someone walk into the school from more than one location without walking past the front office? 
- Can someone walk around the school without having been vetted and without a visitor's badge?
- How does the system and the staff respond to a security breach? How fast is the response time?
- How is the access control system integrated with other security systems, such as video surveillance?
- What are the backup and redundancy measures in place to ensure that the access control system remains functional in the event of a power outage or other system failure?

Contact Absco Solutions at salessupport@abscosolutions.com to get started on a security master plan for your school. Let's come together to address the security challenges facing our schools and create a safe learning environment for all. 
"

Have you thought about applying for a job but you weren't qualified? 
Here are 5 reasons why you should apply.

1.) Learn About the Industry: This is an opportunity to learn about the skills/experience that is in demand.

2.) Gain Experience: Even if you don't get the job, the application & interview process helps you identify areas of improvement, develop your skills, and expand your network.

3.) Increase Your Confidence: It can be challenging to put yourself out there and go through the application process, but doing so can help you build confidence and develop a growth mindset.

4.) Transferable Skills: If you don't have the exact qualifications, you might have transferable skills that could be valuable to the employer.

5.) Unexpected Opportunities: Applying to a job you aren't qualified for can lead to other roles and unexpected opportunities.

Networking is the process of creating and maintaining mutual relationships with people in your personal and professional life who can help you achieve your goals. Where do you start?

First, define your goals: Determine what exactly it is you want to accomplish through networking. Are you looking to find a new job, get additional clients, or to grow your business? 

Second, Identify your network: Go through your list of colleagues, friends, family members, or anyone who can help you get started. 

Third, attend networking events: Attend conferences and events in your field of work to meet new people.

Fourth, Join professional organizations: Join groups that are related to your field of work to connect with similar individuals 

Fifth, Be genuine: Be yourself when meeting new people. Build a real relationship before asking for guidance.

Lastly, Follow up: After meeting someone new be sure to follow up with them to build that professional relationship.

name: FUN.com
summary: Be FUN-of-a-Kind!
description:
Focus on the positive. Be humble. Never be complacent. Embrace nerdy, goofy fun.

Those are some simple ideas, but they're the core values that keep us moving at FUN.com! In 1992, we started as a small costume shop in a garage. Since then, we've grown into one of the largest online retailers in the world, offering products that give our customers a FUN-of-a-Kind experience. A bit corny? Maybe, but that's just a part of our culture!

We don’t just love pop culture and nostalgia. We live it. We work closely with the world’s top brands, like Disney, Fox, Universal, and Warner Bros to design unique apparel, collectibles, and costumes for the fans who love them. We’re the ones who are first in line for the latest Marvel movie and we’ll definitely talk your ear off about Ghostbusters and Care Bears if you’ll let us!

Our team values the genuine curiosity needed to explore new ideas, whether it’s cooking up new product ideas or finding creative ways to connect with our customers. That’s also why we try to provide a flexible environment that lets all our team members grow to their potential, since personal growth and team growth go hand in hand!

Ready to grow along with our team? Visit https://www.fun.com/careers
specialties: Costumes, Toys, Superhero Memorabilia, Party Supplies, Gift Ideas, Apparel, Seasonal Décor, and Pop Culture

Well, we’re looking for a new Human Resources Manager who can offer their leadership to assemble and guide one of those amazing teams! We need someone who is ready to help build, coach, and support the employees in our new Kentucky Distribution Center.

FUN.com has a unique work environment, which blends elements of nerdy, goofy fun, with a constant drive for progress. We encourage curiosity and reward those who can leverage their passion at work. name: Lambert
description:
Founded in 1998, Lambert is a strategic communications and advisory firm specializing in public relations, investor relations and integrated marketing. We focus on giving clients a strong, clear presence in today’s hyper-connected world through a unique blend of strategic thinking and creativity to deliver big ideas that drive business outcomes for clients locally and globally.

With nearly 25 years of continuous growth and innovation, Lambert’s results are driven by a culture of awareness, belonging and allyship. We foster a collaborative, team-based approach to our work propelled by a diverse and inclusive workforce that allows for an open exchange of ideas, solutions, and progress.

Our award-winning team has been recognized by O’Dwyer’s, PR Week, PR News, IR Magazine, the Association for Corporate Growth, PRovoke Media, Inc. 5000 and PRSA, among others.

Headquartered in the Midwest, Lambert has office in Grand Rapids, Detroit, New York, St. Louis and Phoenix.
