posts.text:
Legacy Week has finally arrived 🤩 Organized each spring by the Office of Student Activities and Leadership, the week celebrates traditions from Case Western Reserve's extensive history, including favorites such as the Hudson Relays and Springfest.

Check out The Daily to learn a few ways you can celebrate CWRU’s ever-evolving story during Legacy Week:
Spring is in the air 🌸 Check out our Facebook page to cast a vote for your favorite submission to the CWRU in Bloom photo contest, now until May 1: https://fal.cn/3xE1H

Happy Earth Day from CWRU 🌎 To acknowledge our environmental impact and learn how we can help affect positive change for our planet's health, The Daily sat down with a few CWRU community members passionate about the topic. Take a look:

A team of Case Western Reserve researchers are exploring the unlikely connections between zebrafish and humans—all while uncovering important findings related to humans' hearing and balance. Get the details:

ICYMI: Researchers at Frances Payne Bolton School of Nursing at Case Western Reserve University will continue enhancing care for older adults through a partnership with CVS MinuteClinic, courtesy of a $2.56M grant from The John A. Hartford Foundation. Get the details:

Anne Templeton Zimmerman (MED ‘74) was not only an accomplished physician, but also a strong advocate for human rights and religious freedom across the world. Zimmerman's philanthropic spirit will continue with a $1.5M gift from the late doctor’s husband to establish a professorship in bioethics at Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine. Get the details:

An all-time record-breaking 2,824 members of the CWRU community showed up in support of our annual Day of Giving. Thank you for all you've done—and continue to do—to support our students. #CWRUMakeItPossible

April is Sexual Assault Awareness Month, a time to reflect on and work toward violence prevention in our communities. Learn about events from the Flora Stone Mather Center for Women happening at CWRU this month—and year-round—designed to advance these efforts:

Today, National Gardening Day (April 14), we're celebrating the beauty of flowers and fields with some suggestions of gardens our community can visit. Consider exploring one of these five gardens across #TheLand:

Thanks to the warm, sunny weather we've had across #TheLand, CWRU's campus is showing off—and we want you to as well. We're inviting students, faculty, staff and alumni to snap and share their best pics of our springtime campus in this year's CWRU in Bloom photo contest. Did you know that the Sustainable Development Goals are directly connected to biodiversity and conservation? 

“Goal 15 is about conserving life on land. It is to protect and restore terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and stop biodiversity loss. Healthy ecosystems and the biological diversity they support are a source of food, water, medicine, shelter and other material goods. They also provide ecosystem services – the cleaning of air and water – which sustain life and increase resiliency in the face of mounting pressures.”

- UN Biodiversity

Find out more about the Sustainable Development Goals: https://lnkd.in/eFMNYSQ
https://lnkd.in/gRUNPYFY
#food #diversity #water #sustainabledevelopment #biodiversity #conservation #medicine

Goal 14, Life Below Water, is a Sustainable Development Goal to conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources. The health of our largest ecosystem is threatened by human activity. Oceans and Seas are essential to all life on Earth, and impacts the livelihoods of billions of people.

“Almost half a billion people depend at least partially on small-scale fisheries, which account for 90 per cent of employment in fisheries worldwide.”

- UN Biodiversity

name: Washington Trails Association
summary: WTA mobilizes hikers and everyone who loves the outdoors to explore, steward and champion trails and public lands.
description: Washington Trails Association has a 50 year legacy of engaging the hiking community. WTA enhances hiking experiences in Washington by empowering a diverse and growing community of hikers to explore, steward and protect trails and public lands. WTA is the nation’s largest state-based hiking advocacy and trail maintenance organization, with more than 27,000 members, thousands of volunteers each year, and an online community of more than 500,000. WTA’s annual budget is approximately $8 million. We believe that hiking has a positive impact on people’s hearts and minds and want to ensure that there are trails for everyone, forever.
specialties: volunteer trail maintenance, trusted source of hiking information, advocacy on behalf of hikers and trails, and youth engagement programs

Companies that sponsor Hike-a-Thon are given the opportunity to connect with a broad base of outdoor enthusiasts, while supporting hikers and the trails they love. name: Advanced Construction Robotics
summary: Innovating Infrastructure
description: A leading provider of robotic equipment, ACR is transforming the construction industry by filling the skilled labor gap and increasing overall productivity. Our robots give construction firms the ability to consistently meet growing demand, reduce scheduling risks and improve safety.  TyBOT®, ACR’s first product, is a rebar tying robot that self-navigates, self-ties, and does not require programming or BIM plan input from the working crew. TyBOT’s partner, IronBOT, will lift, carry, and install rebar when it comes to market in 2022. If you would like more information, please contact us at info@constructionrobots.com
specialties: Construction, Robotics, Rebar-tying, Reinforced Concrete, Rebar Installation, Bridge Construction, and Bridges

posts.text:
America's infrastructure is in need of repair. Right here in Pennsylvania alone are 2,354 bridges in poor condition. 74 of those are right in our backyard of Allegheny County.

Pennsylvania is not alone in its pursuit to repair deteriorating bridges. If contractors are going to complete this backlog, they are going to have to get innovative. Recruit TyBOT and IronBOT to repair these bridges safely and efficiently.

#bridges #bridgeconstruction #Pennsylvania #contech #rebar #safety

It’s National Work Zone Awareness Week! Construction work has many potential dangers, so it is important to be aware of what you are doing and what is happening around you. Help stay safe by utilizing some of these practices.

🏗️ Never work underneath a suspended load.
 🚧 Use barricades to separate workers from vehicles, heavy equipment, and falling objects.
👷♂️ For overhead work, secure tools with tethers and use protective measures.
⚠️ Don’t drive or operate machinery if overly tired.

Refer to the CAWP and CPWR websites for more information and resources on work zone safety.

➡️ https://lnkd.in/g2FWNZgZ
➡️ https://lnkd.in/drwKGWq
#CAWPWZSAFETY #NWZAW #WorkZoneSafety #GoOrange4Safety #safety #construction

name: Stratosphere Quality
summary: Providing Quality Support Services to Manufacturers
description: Stratosphere Quality, founded in 2009, is a major global provider of quality assurance and outsourcing solutions, including sorting and inspection services, to manufacturers of parts and components in the automotive, medical device, electronics, home appliance and recreational vehicle industries. As a partner in quality, the company helps suppliers and OEMs identify root cause of quality problems, minimize defects, improve quality, increase efficiency and reduce costs associated with quality issues. Headquartered just northeast of Indianapolis, Indiana, Stratosphere Quality has a geographic reach that includes the United States, Canada, Mexico, Japan, and China.
specialties: quality assurance, outsourcing solutions, inspections, sorting, rework, containment, quality auditing, warehousing, and scanning technology

name: MSIGHTS
summary: Giving marketers control of end-to-end marketing and data operations to maximize performance.
description: Founded in 2004, North Carolina-based MSIGHTS provides cloud-based marketing data integration services to some of the world’s most sophisticated global advertisers. As marketing channels proliferate, so do the data sources marketers must examine in order to quantify results and guide strategy. MSIGHTS services make marketers more efficient and successful by providing a single view of overall marketing performance with actionable insights on what works and what doesn’t. The MSIGHTS cloud-based platform automatically collects and reconciles disparate data, making it immediately available to fuel a wide variety of analytical and visualization tools.
specialties: marketing, marketing operations, marketing results reporting, marketing performance management, marketing analytics, data integration, and data transformation

name: Emigrant Bank
description:
In 1850 a group of Irish emigrants founded Emigrant Bank as a mutual savings bank in New York City. Today, Emigrant is New York’s oldest savings bank, serving local communities with 35 branches and various banking subsidiaries: Emigrant Capital, Emigrant Financial Services, Emigrant Business Credit Corp., Emigrant Funding, New York Private Bank & Trust and Emigrant Mortgage Company.

Emigrant Bank is regulated by both State and Federal regulators. All deposits are insured by the FDIC up to the legal limit.
specialties: Banking, Financial Services, Mortgage, Investing, and Personal Risk Management

name: SeaWorld Parks & Entertainment
description:
SeaWorld Parks & Entertainment™ is a leading theme park and entertainment company providing experiences that matter and inspiring guests to protect animals and the wild wonders of our world. We are one of the world’s foremost zoological organizations and a global leader in animal husbandry, behavioral management, veterinary care and animal welfare. We also rescue and rehabilitate marine and terrestrial animals that are ill, injured, orphaned or abandoned, with the goal of returning them to the wild. The SeaWorld® and Busch Gardens® rescue teams have helped more than 40,000 animals in need over the last 50+ years.

We own or license a portfolio of recognized brands including SeaWorld®, Busch Gardens®, Sesame Place® and Sea Rescue®. Over our more than 50-year history, we have built a diversified portfolio of 12 destination and regional theme parks that are grouped in key markets across the United States. Many of our parks showcase our one-of-a-kind zoological collection and all of our parks feature a diverse array of thrill and family rides, shows, educational demonstrations and/or other attractions with broad demographic appeal which deliver memorable experiences and a strong value proposition for our guests.

We have also produced Parent’s Choice and Emmy Award winning shows like Sea Rescue and The Wildlife Docs that celebrate real & inspirational stories of rescue, rehabilitation and return to the wild by the animal rescue, animal care and veterinary teams at SeaWorld and Busch Gardens, in cooperation with our partners also committed to care for wildlife in need.
specialties: Theme Parks, Education, Conservation, and Entertainment

posts.text:
We are proud to welcome Marisa Thalberg as SeaWorld’s Chief Marketing and Communications Officer. She will begin on April 24.

Marisa is a globally recognized brand-builder and pioneer of digital, social, and eCommerce marketing. She is also a five-time honoree on Forbes’ “World’s Most Influential CMOs” list, among other industry accolades.

Welcome to the team!

Read more: https://lnkd.in/gEmDyCKF

In celebration of National Pet Day, we're excited to introduce you to a few of our Ambassadors' beloved furry companions. 

Get ready to meet some of the most adorable four-legged friends around!

We have been a proud partner of the Killer Whale Research and Conservation Program since its inception and will continue to support this impactful work to help the endangered Southern Resident killer whales.
Thank you for the support, Association of Zoos and Aquariums! To learn more about our conservation efforts, visit https://bit.ly/3JHroi4

All around the world, women get the job done. And at SeaWorld Orlando, it's no different. 

These extraordinary women have such an incredible passion for the work they do and ensure each animal gets the medical care they need every day.

Have you heard the big news?! SeaWorld Rescue has gone GLOBAL 🌏 With the opening of Yas SeaWorld Research & Rescue Yas Island, Abu Dhabi, we've expanded our reach as one of the largest marine animal rescue organizations in the world. This state-of-the-art center is the first dedicated marine research and rescue center for the MENA region and includes a veterinary hospital, rescue clinic, rehabilitation pools, on-site lab, and an aquaculture facility.
Just your mid-week reminder to slow down and enjoy some penguin zen 🐧

Another successful manatee return! On July 8th, the SeaWorld Orlando Rescue team returned Patchouli to her natural environment at the Manatee Observation and Education Center alongside our partners in the Manatee Rescue & Rehabilitation Partnership. This past winter, Patchouli came in for rehabilitation, suffering from poor body condition and buoyancy issues due to the ongoing unusual mortality event. We are grateful to everyone who helped rescue and rehabilitate Patchouli, who has gained 450lbs. to bring her back to a healthy weight.

All activities conducted under USFWS Permit #MA80925C

This week's edition of Sea the World is a "fin-tastic tale" that you won’t want to miss! Join Cindy as she talks to Allison Helms, an Animal Care Specialist at SeaWorld, who shares more about her incredible work with dolphins and many insights into these beautiful animals. Listen here:

We recently sat down with our friends at Hubbs-SeaWorld Research Institute to talk about our longstanding partnership—dating all the way back to SeaWorld's inception—and the work the Institute is doing on both the East and West Coasts.

name: Spring Branch ISD
summary: Inspiring minds. Shaping lives.
description:
At the heart of the Spring Branch Community is its schools. Since its creation as a suburban school district in the 1940s, SBISD has been nationally renowned for providing quality education.

 than 180,000 residents of the city of Houston and the six incorporated villages surrounded by the city - Bunker Hill, Hedwig, Hilshire, Hunters Creek, Piney Point and Spring Valley - comprise the school district.

The district's dedication to small neighborhood schools is credited with contributing to the success of our schools and our students.

Each school day, the district welcomes more than 33,000 students through the doors of its 45 campuses including:

26 elementary schools
7 regular middle schools
3 charter middle schools
4 traditional high school
1 alternative high school

name: Highlands County BCC
summary: Follow us on Twitter, @HighlandsFLBCC, and Facebook
description: Highlands County has a five-member Board of County Commissioners. The BCC is charged with setting county policy and spending tax payer dollars wisely.

posts.text:
At today’s Board of County Commissioner’s meeting, two of our Fire Rescue members were recognized in front of commissioners, staff, and the community for recent promotions they have received.

The promotion of firefighter/EMT Jarrod Akins to lieutenant was recognized, and the promotion of Lt. Todd Barton to battalion chief was also recognized.

Many family members and staff members were on to cheer them on. Lt. Akins had his badge pinned on by his daughter, Alivia, and BC Barton had his badge pinned on by his wife, Melissa.

Yesterday, Fire Rescue hosted Leadership Highlands Class of 2023 at Station 19, and talked to class members about the importance of learning hands-only CPR.

After the presentation, Fire Rescue members gave a station tour, where several Leadership Highlanders were able to climb in an ambulance, check out an engine, take a look inside the Hazmat response trailer, and put on some gear and swing a sledgehammer at a forcible entry training door. 

Division Chief Dustin Fitch faced off against Natural Resources Manager Dawn Ritter at breaking through the forcible entry training door - but we won't say who won! 😉 Along with Dawn, two other County employees are participating in Leadership Highlands this year - Healthy Families Highlands Program Manager Cynthia Acevedo and Zoning Supervisor Rachel Barry!

Fire Rescue members were also at today's Mason G. Smoak Foundation High School Career Day. Personnel had a great time speaking to local students about how the department operates and the many opportunities available to them in the future!

Members were able to show students various equipment used in the field, from bunker gear and life-saving tools to operating a hose and checking out the engine and ambulance that were on site.

Thank you again to the three local chambers of commerce and Leadership Highlands for helping make this event a success!

County staff participated in the Mason G. Smoak Foundation High School Career Day and had a great time today speaking to local students about the many opportunities available at the Board of County Commissioners!

Highlands County Fire Rescue promoted two of its own today to the rank of lieutenant in front of a full room at its headquarters.

Firefighter/EMT Max Sherwood and Firefighter/EMT Ceceil Williams passed their lieutenant’s exam in December, and at today’s promotion ceremony both received their new officer’s badge and gear. Max had his badge pinned on by his wife, Sarah, and Cecil had his pinned on by his mom, Sharon.

Please join us in wishing them well as they start this new phase in their careers with us!

The Veteran Services Office held its annual Christmas meal distribution event Monday, Dec. 19. Highlands County county commissioners and staff handed out holiday dinners with all the trimmings as well as gifts to about 50 local veterans and their families.

The VSO has been holding this event for the last 13 years.

If you are a veteran, a family member of a veteran, or know someone who is, and you need assistance, please call 863-402-6623 so staff can help.

#communityfirst

Fire Rescue wants to take a moment to congratulate District Chief Steve Irving with Venus District Fire Station 45 - Highlands County Fire Rescue on his retirement.

Chief Irving has been in the fire services for 52 years, starting in New Hampshire and culminating with 14 years of volunteer service here in Highlands County in District 45, the last 8 of which he served as district chief.

"Steve has been the last person standing in District 45 for some time," Public Safety Director Laney Stearns said. "We'd like to thank you for your long-standing service and dedication to the residents and people of Highlands County. You are greatly appreciated."

Dedication like this, in this profession, is a testament to the character of Steve and all the firefighters, volunteer and paid, who serve our Highlands County community. Thank you Steve and enjoy your retirement!

This morning, Fire Rescue members took part in a birthday drive-by event in Sebring for a World War II veteran who is turning 100 years young!

William "Bill" Price was drafted into the U.S. Army in January 1943 and served in Africa and Italy. His rank was a T/5 (Tech 5).

posts.text:
We're proud to be sponsoring Adwanted Events (Formerly Mediatel Events)' most ambitious conference to date: The Future of Brands.

On Tuesday, April 25th, industry leaders will come together to learn from each other to create a better tomorrow, stand up for excellence, and make a difference in the future of the advertising market. 

Our very own Kelvin Cery will be taking the stage alongside Chloe Davis, Joe Goldberg, Lou Nylander, and Kanchan Lad, to discuss modern marketing and what methods brands need to adapt (or revert back to) in order to keep up with the rapidly evolving demands.

We're excited to learn more from the best in the industry, and we can't wait to see you there!

Creators are always looking to do more, simplify workflows, and improve output, and having the RIGHT tools at your disposal can make all the difference.

#contentcreator #creators #tools #toolsforsuccess #contentmarketingtips

Looks like Instagram is getting (another) update!

Last week, Adam Mosseri announced 4 exciting new #Reels features to "make it easier to create and earn from Reels and better understand how they're performing." 

Creators, brands, and businesses can REALLY benefit from these new features, and we're excited to try them out ourselves! Here are the 4 new updates IG will be rolling out over the next few weeks:

💥 Trends - Head to your Professional Dashboard and tap "Reels Trends" to see what's trending around the world on Reels.

💥 Insights - Two new metrics - Average Watch Time and Total Watch Time - are being introduced to give users a deeper understanding of how their Reels are performing.

💥 Editing - You'll now be able to edit your content with layers so you can see your video and audio separately. Other layers to be introduced over time!

💥 Gifts - Gifts are expanding to Australia, Canada, Mexico, France, New Zealand, and the UK. You'll also be able to see if anyone has given you a digital gift so you can reach out to say thank you.

Thoughts on these updates? Let us know! 👇

#instagram #updates #socialmedia #igtips #reelsinstagram

Alvin and The Chipmunks paved the way for the hottest music trend today. 🐿

Yup, you heard us correctly. Sped-up versions of songs have been dominating TikTok for over a year - which is basically an eternity for social media - and are responsible for countless artists seeing incredible spikes in streaming numbers. It's also probably the reason your subconscious occasionally hears songs at 2x speed. 

So why exactly is such a simple trend sticking around for so long - and actually working? 🤔 

🎵 It allows users to enjoy more of a song in a shorter amount of time (aka 2x the content)
🎵 It's allowing songs, both old and new, to climb the Billboard charts
🎵 It's giving record labels something new to incorporate into their release strategies

For more on this, and how your brand can quickly and easily license today's most popular songs for campaign success, check out our latest music column ➡️ https://lnkd.in/eyND-94N

🎧 Want to listen our favorite sped-up songs? Yuanna Demi Kirolos, our Director of Music and Brand Partnerships, created an awesome BENlabs Spotify playlist that we promise you'll have on repeat for weeks! 👉 https://lnkd.in/eB3G4eBG
#tiktok #tiktokmarketing #trending #music #socialmediatrends

"When you're not that big (of a creator), the tools you use can really help you scale yourself and do all those other things that maybe aren't in your natural wheelhouse." - Tyler Folkman told dot.LA, discussing the rise of short-form content and our new TubeBuddy AI tool, Suggested Shorts.

With this tool, data-driven insights help creators:
🔎 Improve how their content is found and watched
📽️ Simplify the process of creating Shorts (or Reels or Tiktoks 👀)
⏰ Reduce production time
🛠️ Receive creative support in growing their channel
👥 Expand their reach with new audiences
💰 Tap into a NEW revenue stream from the expanded YouTube Partner Program

For more, check out the full article 👇

As traditional marketing tactics become less effective and ad avoidance continues to rise, brands are turning to all different forms of content to engage with consumers.

Last week, Maral Beylerian sat down with Microsoft's Alison Pember to discuss these different forms of content - and how brands can use them to reach new audiences - at the Association of National Advertisers's Content Marketing conference. 

One of our biggest takeaways from the conference - brands NEED to be sure to stay true to their voice and values. A few of our other learnings for brands to keep in mind...

💡 The entertainment landscape is constantly evolving and it’s hard to reach audiences in a fragmented landscape

💡 By tapping into entertainment - especially product placement - your content strategy can deliver deepening engagement, increase cultural relevance, and help build an emotional connection

💡 It’s important to prioritize this type of marketing, create content with purpose and have an authentic voice in order to grow and develop your content strategy

More on our takeaways here 👉 https://lnkd.in/eBc-WHaS
#productplacement #entertainment #advertising #brandmarketing

Ready to expand your AI vocabulary? 🤖

As marketing professionals, we don’t NEED to become AI experts. 

That said, some understanding of key AI terms, how AI works, and some insight into what problems we might direct AI to help us understand and solve will certainly help.

Which of these 7 terms excites you the most? Let us know in the comments! 👇 

#ai #artificialintelligence #aitechnology #aitools #aitrends

name: Achieving True Self
summary: Autism and Behavioral Health Services in MD, PA, and WV
description:
Achieving True Self provides treatment and consultation services to individuals, families and their surrounding communities (schools, organizations) impacted by one or more behavioral health diagnoses, including those affected by an autism spectrum disorder in Maryland, Pennsylvania and West Virginia.

Our team takes pride in creating innovative plans grounded in evidence-based practice in order to help people of all ages achieve their unique goals. We recognize that each and every person’s journey is different, and therefore our approach to treatment capitalizes on a person’s strengths and desires in order to address deficits.

Treatment is delivered utilizing techniques based in Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). ABA has over five decades of scientific research validating its effectiveness.  We utilize such research-based interventions so that our consumers can feel confident in service delivery.

We recognize that to provide the best services, you need the best team members.  At Achieving True Self, we continue to develop a team of highly experienced clinicians and motivated administration who are eager to grow personally and value ongoing professional development.

We are passionate about meeting our consumers and families where they are, and are committed to providing quality care with integrity. 

At Achieving True Self - people matter.
specialties: Applied Behavior Analyst, Autism, Board Certified Behavior Analyst, Assessment, Behavioral, Mental Health, Registered Behavior Technician, Behavioral Health, and ABA

She has worked with children in various settings as a student and a clinician, including The Watson Institute (special education) and Children’s South (outpatient center part of UPMC Children’s Hospital). Elle lives in Allegheny County with her husband, Jesse, and daughter, Evelyn, as well as their two dogs, Delilah and Prim.

U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Vision: 
A GREAT engineering force of highly disciplined people working with our partners through disciplined thought and action to deliver innovative and sustainable solutions to the Nation’s engineering challenges.
specialties: Civil Works Projects, Environmental Services, Construction, Recreation Opportunities, and Military Support Operations

posts.text:
Today, the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) joins our global community in the celebration of Earth Day. 

Protecting and preserving our environment is an enduring mission for USACE. We have more than 38,000 dedicated professionals working together and with our partners to provide sustainable solutions that support our environment and the communities we serve across the globe.

Learn how we are Investing in Our Planet: https://lnkd.in/gmNJPDZx

Tune in for the latest episode of Inside the Castle! In this episode Inside the Castle talks about sustainable and innovative military construction with Kathleen O’Neill, Dr. Christopher Thompson, and Dr. Robert Moser.
 
The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) is supporting the Department of Defense and White House Administration’s efforts to reduce harmful impacts on the environment by incorporating innovation and sustainable materials in our building processes.
 
Additionally, USACE partners with the Army, Navy, Air Force, and private industry to execute trial construction projects on military installations that meet the NDAA’s sustainability objectives.
 
USACE has a goal to lower the lifetime embodied carbon emission of infrastructure by at least 30% from established baselines and to incorporate sustainable materials.
 
Listen in and learn how USACE is developing sustainable infrastructure solutions for the nation's bases, camps, posts and stations.
 
Apple Podcasts: https://lnkd.in/g_KfuyC
 
Google Podcasts: https://lnkd.in/gRYbYRG

David Margo, Lead Civil Engineer with the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Risk Management Center provides critical insights about model frameworks for calculating and portraying risk estimates to members of the U.S. Society on Dams during the 2023 Infrastructure Resilience Conference in Charleston, S.C. name: Caban Systems
summary: We offer intelligent energy storage solutions that optimize site operation for reliable and clean power delivery.
description:
Caban is accelerating the shift to sustainability for telecommunications providers and tower operators by providing access to affordable, reliable and renewably sourced power. 

Caban Systems, Inc. is an energy infrastructure provider, offering end-to-end solutions for some of the largest telecommunications companies in the world.  Pioneering a best-in-class intelligent energy management system for the telecommunication infrastructure industry, Caban delivers modern infrastructure solutions to its customers, substantially reducing operational expenses, GHG emissions and increasing uptime. Caban designs and manufactures software-enabled lithium-ion energy management systems for primary and backup power telecom applications. 

Why? We are passionate about sustainability, energy access, and helping even the most remote communities reap the benefits of greater connection and communication.
specialties: Energy Storage, Lithium Ion Batteries, Renewable Energy, Power, Storage, Power Storage, Environmental, Telecommunications, Mobile Network Operators, Silicon Valley Power, Batteries, IoT, Cloud Services, SaaS, and EaaS

posts.text:
Today we celebrate the 5th anniversary of Caban Systems! 🎉 Founded in 2018 by Alexandra Rasch Castillo and Brian Pevear, Caban has grown from an #energystorage innovator to a valued clean energy partner.

In a few short years, the Caban team has developed world-class battery technology, a suite of energy storage systems, an intelligent software solution, and an Energy-as-a-Service business model to better serve our customers. These solutions are powering hundreds of critical infrastructure sites across the Americas, generating over 1,200 MWh of #cleanenergy to date. ⚡

All of this is possible thanks to our dedicated leaders, team members, investors, board, and clients who are all committed to a clean energy future.

#cleantech #cleantechstartup #startup #climatetech #criticalinfrastructure #telecommunications
https://lnkd.in/gKrat76z

On March 28, Caban Systems CTO & Co-Founder Brian Pevear will be speaking at IWCE 2023, hosted in Las Vegas. IWCE is the premier event for the critical communications industry.

He will be featured on the “Alternative Power Options for On-and Off-Grid Sites” panel, which will showcase best practices for transitioning #telecom sites to clean, resilient #energy. He will discuss how Caban’s turnkey solution helps reduce energy costs and increase power reliability - all while lowering carbon emissions.

Learn more and register on the IWCE website: https://lnkd.in/gpvGS9_V
#IWCE2023 #cleanenergy #energytransition #energystorage #telecommunications #criticalinfrastructure

We are proud to support Tigo Colombia in this achievement. Deploying intelligent #energystorage is a winning strategy for #telecom operators worldwide.

And #decarbonization doesn't have to be a compromise. Using decentralized #cleanenergy significantly drives down costs while improving reliability. On-grid towers benefit by reducing their reliance on the grid, while off-grid towers can eliminate the need for fossil fuel generators. Learn more: https://lnkd.in/g-FANJqm

We're hiring!

https://lnkd.in/ehqdqShH
We're hiring!

We are excited to announce the appointment of Caban Systems’ new Chief Financial Officer, Charles Bailey! Charles is an experienced finance executive with an operations and engineering background. He has extensive experience in small, medium and large companies both domestic and international. 

With decades of experience across multiple industries including renewable energy, telecommunications, and energy transition, he is well positioned to manage the company’s finance operations.

Charles has spent over 25 years as a finance executive, most recently as the Vice President of Finance for CECO Environmental, as well as the CFO, Americas Region for Delta Electronics. He received his Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering at Texas Tech, and later received his M.B.A at the University of Houston-Clear Lake.

Welcome, Charles!

Caban Systems is excited to announce the appointment of our new Chief Operating Officer, Allen Pitts! Allen is an experienced operator and global business leader.

With decades of experience within the renewable energy and telecommunications industry, he is well positioned to execute the company’s long-term goals and facilitate day-to-day operations at Caban.

Previously, Allen spent over 30 years leading operations within the energy conversion sector, most recently as the regional president of Eltek AS. He received his B.S. in computer science and engineering management from Southern Methodist University. 

Welcome, Allen!
Connect with Caban Systems CEO and Founder, Alexandra Rasch Castillo, at the World Economic Forum in #Davos - DM us to schedule a meeting.

I meet a lot of accountants who aspire to be CFOs. Here's the thought experiment I ask:

You run into your CEO in the restroom and he/she tells you from the next stall over that your company is considering a new product line. Do you immediately think about how this affects...

- Financial reporting
- Month-end close processes
- KPI dashboards that would be useful
- Revenue recognition policies
- Auditor relationships
- Taxes

Or does your mind turn to...

- The size of the opportunity
- The resources and investment this could require
- The resulting ROIC of the opportunity
- How the business could finance the investment
- How the opportunity could help the company reach its goals and further its vision
- Whether the company has a sustainable competitive advantage in the market and how it could develop one if not
- How the company's board and investors will view the opportunity
- How the opportunity will affect relationships with other stakeholders, from creditors to competitors to members of the community (and everyone in between)
- Whether there is a role for M&A to accelerate growth in the space
- What pair of limited-edition Jordans you’re going to buy to celebrate this
- And, most importantly, whether the opportunity is likely to increase shareholder value or detract from it

Be honest. If the former, that's fine—but that's the mindset a controller needs. If you want to be a valuable CFO, cultivate the perspective of the latter.

name: Altair
summary: A global tech company providing software & cloud solutions in the areas of simulation, HPC, and artificial intelligence.
description:
Altair (Nasdaq: ALTR) is a global leader in computational science and intelligence, which provides software and cloud solutions in the areas of simulation, high-performance computing (HPC), and artificial intelligence (AI). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world while creating a more sustainable future. 

Our vision is to leverage computational science to drive innovation and intelligent decisions for a more connected, safe, and sustainable future.  

Wherever you are and whatever you’re doing, Altair’s solutions surround you – keeping you safer, more connected, and more productive. They can be found in big places and small — on highways, hospitals, and hockey rinks, in stadiums, skyscrapers, and subways, and in banks, bikes, and boats.

A critical component of our success has been our company culture, based on our core values of innovation, envisioning the future, communicating honestly and broadly, seeking technology and business firsts, and embracing diversity. We continually recruit for top talent and invest in our global workforce to fuel diversity, professional and personal growth, and innovation. At Altair, diversity and experiences are embraced and essential to our success and long-term growth. We are proud of the recognition our world-class culture, diversity, and sustainability efforts have garnered, including being named to Inc. magazines Best Led Companies List, Newsweek's Most Loved Workplaces, and Investor’s Business Daily’s Best 100 ESG Companies list.

For nearly 40 years, Altair has helped companies in their digital transformation efforts to make smarter decisions, save costs, reduce waste, accelerate time-to-market, improve business performance, and evolve to a data-driven culture.

In solving our customers’ toughest challenges and delivering unparalleled service, we are helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.

summary: A Retail Access & Ads Platform Centered on the Member
description:
At Sam’s Club, we are member obsessed. We lead with this obsession by offering a curated assortment of high-quality products at an incredible value. We lead with this obsession by providing our members with a multi-touchpoint experience, whether they are shopping our Clubs, on SamsClub.com, in app, or with Curbside Pickup and Delivery. We lead with this obsession every day.

We know our members want a shopping experience that is easy, convenient, and personalized. And we know that our agencies, ad tech platforms, suppliers, and marketers want to reach our members efficiently and effectively. With MAP [Member Access Platform], our journey starts with our member. Next, we create and give partners experiences, tools, and opportunities that help members discover new products at the time they need and want them.

MAP’s mission is to provide the most valuable and additive ads experience to our member. It's our member-first approach that differentiates us, along with the combination of our platform, our products, our people, our processes, and our first-party data. 

We are member-obsessed. We are associate-inspired. We are partner-focused.

name: WÜSTHOF
summary: Made in Solingen
description:
WÜSTHOF has one mission since its beginning in 1814: crafting the finest knives that last for generations. Founded in Solingen, Germany, known for centuries as the "City of Blades", the brand is owned by the seventh generation of the WÜSTHOF family. In their state-of-the-art manufacturing facility, the company creates a variety of knife collections and cooking utensils. WÜSTHOF is appreciated for its art of crafting; it takes over forty manufacturing steps to make a WÜSTHOF knife, with many made by hand, using traditional skills and techniques. Forged knives from the famous CLASSIC Collection have become the symbol of WÜSTHOF and are a lifelong companion for chefs all over the world. With over 500 employees in North America and Europe, the brand is available at leading culinary retailers worldwide.

Throughout recent years, consumers rediscovered that healthy eating is the foundation of a healthy body and mind. Along with the pleasure of preparing and enjoying homemade meals together with family and friends, consumers recognize that a healthy planet is an essential element of this lifestyle. At a time where disposable products cloud the future of our planet, WÜSTHOF is loved for its commitment to responsibly crafting premium products that last a lifetime and are often handed down to the next generation. This appreciation and emotional connection recently led the company to launch its direct-to-consumer business. As WÜSTHOF builds their bond with the consumer, they will take this relationship further by creating and sharing digital content and tangible experiences.

WÜSTHOF, what brings us together every day is the joy of a tasty and healthy meal.
specialties: Cutting, Sharpening, Storage, and Care

WÜSTHOF is bringing colour into the kitchen! 

We're thrilled to introduce Classic Colour in five stylish shades, an extension of our best-selling Classic series. Like the Classic Original, the fully forged knives in the Classic Colour collection have optimal balance and high stability, thanks to the full tang and an impressive sharpness that allows for precise movements. We're in the middle of Colorectal Awareness Month, and here's some important info you need to know:

•	One in 24 people will be diagnosed with colorectal cancer in their lifetime, and it’s the second deadliest cancer in the U.S. 
•	At age 45, people should get screened to detect precancerous cells or early-stage cancer, which is when doctors can prevent or treat the disease most effectively. After that, screening should happen every 10 years.
•	People may need to be screened before age 45 or more frequently than others if they have conditions such as inflammatory bowel disease, Crohn’s disease, ulcerative colitis, or a personal or family history of colorectal cancer. 
•	It’s important to speak with your healthcare provider about when to begin screening and how often to get tested.
•	Kinney Drugs does carry what’s called a FIT test or (fecal immunochemical test) which detects blood in the stool that you may not be able to see with the naked eye. It’s not a substitute for a colonoscopy, but it’s easy, inexpensive, and can be done right at home. No prescription needed.
•	Also, the Colorectal Cancer Alliance offers a free quiz to help you answer the question: "Do I need to get screened for colorectal cancer?" at: https://lnkd.in/etuDhWqQ.
This is going to be great! #forthekids #esop #ownership ❤️

Découvrons ici le parcours de la DG des Jardins de Renoir, Mme Lyne Grenier, ainsi que les facettes de son quotidien. Toute jeune, Lyne est plongée dans l’univers de l’immobilier et de la construction, car son père y oeuvre. Elle était loin de se douter que les notions apprises alors lui seraient d’une grande aide un jour! Mais Lyne a la fibre entrepreneurial et elle s’intéresse à tout ce qui touche l’administration et la gestion. Alors qu’elle complète sa formation au collège Montmorency, elle se découvre une passion pour tout ce qui touche aux ressources humaines.
 
Lyne est une jeune femme pétillante et ambitieuse. Sans expérience en restauration, elle commence à travailler dans la cuisine d’une chaîne de restaurants connue. Ses qualités de leader sont remarqués ce qui lui permet de gravir les échelons jusqu’au poste de gérante adjointe principale de la succursale. À l’époque, les réseaux de recherche d’emploi débutent et Lyne décide de se créer un profil sur « juste pour le fun ». Elle veut comprendre comment cette technologie fonctionne alors qu’elle complète un certificat en administration et travaille toujours en restauration. À sa grande surprise, elle reçoit un appel des Jardins de Renoir. Un poste de maître d’hôtel est vacant. Elle se présente à l’entrevue et malgré qu’elle ne connaisse pas du tout l’industrie des résidences, elle obtient le poste. Nous sommes en 2003 et Lyne est
jeune maman. La rémunération et les horaires de la résidence répondent à ses besoins. Elle accepte donc ce nouveau défi qui allait la conduire jusqu’à la direction générale quelques années plus
tard.
 
Lyne est persévérante et à chaque fois qu’une opportunité s’offre à elle, elle la saisie. C’est ainsi qu’à peine quelques mois après son embauche comme maître d’hôtel, elle devient adjointe à la direction puis directrice des RH. Tout est à faire. Le défi est de taille et Lyne le relève avec brio! Cogir construit un agrandissement qui portera le nombre d’appartements à 740 et Lyne est nommée DG adjointe au côté du DG Philippe Benoit. En janvier 2020, Philippe accepte un poste de DG dans une autre résidence Cogir. La porte est ouverte pour Lyne qui accepte le rôle de DG à quelques semaines de ce qui
allait être une période très tumultueuse en RPA. « J’ai débuté mon nouveau poste au meilleur moment car peu importe le nombre d’années d’expérience qu’un DG pouvait avoir, nous devions tout réapprendre en raison de la pandémie » partage-t‘elle en riant.
 
« J’adore mon poste. C’est un milieu stimulant et très humain où l’on retrouve un bel équilibre entre la gestion et la chaleur des contacts
humains avec les résidents, leur famille et les membres de l’équipe.
Chaque journée est différente et l’on touche à plusieurs sphères d’activités ce qui rend le quotidien très intéressant. Les
résidents sont des gens extraordinaires. Les côtoyer est un privilège très enrichissant » conclut-elle.

Le 21 mars dernier, Marc Doré, président développement et construction de Cogir Immobilier était l'un des membres du panel Batimatech afin de démontrer l’importance des facteurs ESG (environnementaux, sociaux et de gouvernance) pour les entreprises en construction et en immobilier.

En somme, les facteurs ESG sont de plus en plus considérés comme des éléments clés de la stratégie d’investissement des entreprises.

Voir ici les détails supplémentaires : https://lnkd.in/eTNkxRUq
#entreprises #immobilier #construction #esg

Les immeubles Mostra sont reconnus pour leur milieu de vie animé où les échanges humains sont nombreux mais parfois certains petits moments de bonheur n'ont pas de prix pour tisser des liens entre les habitants d'un immeuble.

Le Mostra Newman a la chance d'avoir en ses murs plusieurs familles brésiliennes. En cette délicieuse saison des sucres, l'équipe a décidé de leurs faire découvrir quelques desserts traditionnels bien québécois. Tous se sont sucrés le bec et que dire de la tire! Un vrai délice qui particulièrement plu aux plus jeunes!

summary: Equips and mobilizes the legal profession, promotes reform of the law and upholds the rule of law and access to justice.
description: The New York City Bar Association (www.nycbar.org) is a voluntary organization with 24,000 members. Since its founding in 1870, the City Bar has been dedicated to maintaining the high ethical standards of the legal profession, promoting reform of the law and providing service to the profession and the public. The City Bar's 150 Committees issue hundreds of reports and present hundreds of events annually. The Legal Referral Service matches vetted lawyers with clients. The City Bar Center for CLE provides continuing legal education for lawyers. The City Bar Justice Center provides pro bono legal services to the disadvantaged. Protecting the public’s welfare remains one of the Association’s highest priorities.
specialties: Legal Education, Access to Justice, Public Service, Pro Bono, and CLE

name: CAE USA
summary: Providing digitally immersive training & operational support solutions for multi-domain operations.
description:
CAE USA, located in Tampa Florida, provides modeling and simulation technologies, integrated training solutions and training system support services for various defense and government agencies in the USA, Central and South America. CAE USA provides blended training solutions, fully integrated simulation products, and training services and curriculum that are capable of meeting military customers and original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) training requirements.

CAE's Defense and Security business unit focuses on helping prepare military customers to develop and maintain the highest levels of mission readiness. CAE USA, located in Tampa Florida, is part of CAE's Defense and Security business unit with specific responsibility for serving the United States, South America and select international markets. CAE USA includes over 1,000 employees and is the largest segment within CAE's Defense and Security business unit. The organization leverages the full breadth of CAE's capabilities, technologies and solutions and provides simulation products, training services and training centers that contribute to the preparedness and readiness of United States and allied warfighters. 

CAE USA is a U.S. corporation that operates under a Special Security Agreement (SSA) with the U.S. Department of Defense. As a U.S. corporation operating under an SSA, CAE USA has its own U.S. board of directors that monitors and oversees all company activities related to classified and export-controlled information, security procedures, and company management. The President and General Manager of CAE USA reports directly to the CAE USA Board of Directors.
specialties: Aviation Simulation Training, Defense and Security , and Aviation and Aerospace

description:
SurgiReal Products' mission is excellence in clinical skills and surgical training.  SurgiReal started with the simple idea of making learning easier, convenient and more efficient. We have created better training methods, better education, better outcomes, and excellence in clinical skills and surgical training.

SurgiReal Products provides "life-like" clinical skills and surgical training technology to medical, veterinary, physician assistant and graduate nursing schools and their students. SurgiReal Products are also available for trauma response training for military medical personnel. Surgical skills simulators are available for comprehensive training and improved surgical outcomes. The realism of the SurgiReal technology reduces the need for live animal procedures. Through the use of SurgiReal technologies, SurgiReal simulators provide the most realistic and cost effective clinical skills and surgical training platforms currently available.

name: TES - The Employment Solution
description:
TES delivers IT and Engineering staff augmentation solutions across the North American market.  We give our clients the winning edge through constant innovation, technological savvy, and a customer-centred approach that influences everything we do.  We give our candidates access to exclusive opportunities in leading-edge technologies and organizations, and a chance to enhance their skills and build their dream career. TES is fully pandemic-ready, with alternate and backup delivery channels to protect the flow of services to clients and candidates.

Our trademark is service; service that is personal, ethical, responsive, and geared to both meeting and anticipating your needs.  It’s what our clients mention first when they talk about us.  Our willingness to take your challenges on board and go the extra mile has made us the staffing solutions provider of choice for companies that lead their own industries.  We’re proud to contribute to their success.

Our deep, broad skill resources can supply any IT or Engineering requirement; we are the first and best source for high-demand and specialty “niche” talent.  We offer career counseling and subsidized training to our candidates to ensure that they’re poised to meet emerging trends in the employment scene.  

TES also offers a complete suite of staff augmentation services to plan, manage and deliver IT and Engineering projects of any scope, nationwide.  We also offer HR-oriented solutions that will help you with all aspects of your HR function, from research, planning and strategy to competitive salary surveys, and assistance with the day-to-day burden of payroll administration.
specialties: Information Technology, Engineering, Technical, Aerospace, Managed Services, and Professional Services

name: The Canadian Brewhouse
summary: Our House Is Your House
description:
Let us introduce ourselves and get to know each other!

The Canadian Brewhouse started in Alberta in 2002 with one location that has since grown to 31! Nineteen of our locations are in Alberta, including; the Edmonton area, Grande Prairie, Lloydminster, Red Deer, Camrose, Fort McMurray, Calgary, Okotoks, Airdrie and Cochrane! We also have locations in Regina and Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, and Winnipeg, Manitoba!

We opened our first Canadian Brewhouse & Grill location in Kelowna, British Columbia in 2015, and are continuing to expand in BC. Our Abbotsford location opened in 2016, and Prince George, Fort Saint John & Richmond opened in 2017. In fact, The Canadian Brewhouse, and The Canadian Brewhouse & Grill will be growing for many years to come.

Our one-of-a-kind Canadian themed sports bar & grill has an extensive menu of appetizers, entrees, drinks and amazing specials every night of the week.

You’ll note our Canadian decor starts right when you walk up to our huge Inuksuk at our doors and continues throughout the restaurant in a “cheeky” Canadian fashion.

We promise, when you come to The Canadian Brewhouse, you’ll instantly feel at home, because our house is your house…only we have way more TVs! You won’t find a better selection of screens anywhere for the sports you love! We even provide tabletop speakers for those nights when multiple sports and teams are playing.

We also believe being part of a community means giving back. We’ve been raising funds for various charities through events and fundraisers for over 10 years. Charities like The Stollery Children’s Hospital Foundation, Breast Cancer Research, Prostate Cancer (Movember) and many local initiatives that are important to our neighbours in various communities.

Our people are the real success of our company. If you're interested in being a part of the Brew crew, visit us at http://thecanadianbrewhouse.com/work-with-us/ and fill out an application today!

Our house is your house, The Canadian Brewhouse
specialties: Food, Beer, hospitality, sports, entertainment, service, and mixology

name: Benco Dental
summary: Driving Dentistry Forward
description:
Benco Dental is the largest privately owned, full-service distributor of dental supplies, dental equipment, dental consulting and equipment services in the United States. Founded in 1930 by Benjamin Cohen, the company has remained family owned and focused on the unique mission of "delivering success smile after smile". Headquartered in Pittston, Pennsylvania, Benco Dental is the nation's fastest-growing dental distributor with more than 50 regional showroom locations and five distribution centers servicing more than 30,000 dental professionals in all 50 states.  

Benco is consistently voted a Best Place to Work in Pennsylvania (where we're headquartered) and a Certified Great Place to Work by Fortune. 

Benco Dental provides more supply and equipment options than any other full-service dental distributor – an offering enhanced by a comprehensive suite of services, including office design, equipment repair, practice coaching, financial planning and wealth management, real estate consulting, recruitment, clinical education, financing, peer-to-peer learning and dental-specific technology solutions. These services are supported by more than 400 professionally trained sales representatives and 300 factory-trained service technicians.
specialties: Dental Supplies, Dental Equipment, Dental Technology, Dental Products, Dental Business Solutions, Dental Office Design & Architecture, and Dental Hardware & Software

JAKKS Pacific, Inc. (NASDAQ: JAKK) is a leading designer, manufacturer and marketer of toys and consumer products sold throughout the world, with its headquarters in Santa Monica, California. name: People Performance Resources, LLC
summary: What can we do for you? Our services are always tailored to your needs.
description:
Located in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area, People Performance Resources, LLC (PPR) was established in 2010 as a consulting organization concentrating on overall resources strategies, outsourcing services, executive placements, and recruiting. We have developed a reputation for excellence among small to mid-size businesses and well-established nonprofits. 

WHAT SETS US APART 

Every time we are engaged as a strategic HR business partner, our clients receive the highest level of personal commitment and a dedication regarded as "the best". We pride ourselves on becoming an extension of your organization to show a unified vision to all your employees. We provide a quantifiable return on your investment because every dollar you spend goes directly towards developing best practices. Our services are customized for each client.   Here is a brief list of what we can offer:

 . Certified HR professionals 
 . Minimized risk and maximum value 
 . Experts skilled in maintaining compliance with constantly changing regulations 
 . Employee engagement
 . Benefits selection and negotiation partnerships 
 . Payroll systems evaluation and administration
 . Employee handbook creation or updates
 . Training and development tools and programs customized to fit your specific needs 
 . State-of-the-art performance management systems 
 . Employee relations consultants trained in handling any situation 
 . Termination assistance, guidance, and off-boarding processes which minimize risks
 
At People Performance Resources, we are glad to demonstrate the results and success that our clients have experienced. Reach out for more information!

Having motivated employees on board can significantly benefit an organization by infusing it with positive and productive energy. These employees have a certain drive, work ethic, and willingness to take the initiative, be creative, and work well with others, which will allow companies to reap the rewards of increased productivity and engagement. On the other hand, highly skilled employees who lack motivation may need more direction and supervision to reach desired outcomes. While skills are crucial, motivation can be the driving force behind unlocking an employee's full potential and creating a lasting impact in the workplace.
.
.
.
.
.

description: URBN Urban Outfitters, Inc. (www.urbn.com) is a portfolio of global consumer brands comprised of Anthropologie, BHLDN, Free People, FP Movement, Terrain, Urban Outfitters, Nuuly and Menus & Venues. At URBN, we Lead with Creativity…. Creativity guides our approach to product, environment, experience, and community. It drives our vision, strategy, and decision-making. It touches every job at URBN. Over the last 50 years, we have inspired our customers through our creative and entrepreneurial approach to products and services.

posts.text: We are so proud to partner with FABSCRAP and to be featured in this Earth Month op-ed by Co-Founder and Creative Director Camille Diane Tagle. We are excited to continue our investments in recycling, downcycling, and upcycling through innovative partners like FABSCRAP. #earthmonth #recycling

“I am passionate about the work we do to service our customers and it is important to me that our team knows the score and how we plan to WIN.”

Meet Debbie Parkhill, Director of Fulfillment of URBN's newest Fulfillment Center coming this summer to Kansas City, KS. Debbie joined the North America Supply Chain team in September 2022. She brings with her 18 years of Supply Chain and Retail experience and her incredible passion for #people.

Debbie’s Mission for KC1:

• Establish a #culture where people are empowered and can bring their creative ideas to work and help scale the business. 
• Develop a talent pipeline for North America. 
• Ensuring we deliver against our goals in Safety, Quality, Cost, People and Delivery to the Customer. 
• Positively impact our #community in which we serve. 
• Engage in long range planning and serving our brand partners as we action and implement new milestones across the company to exceed the expectations of our customers.

More than anything else, Debbie is excited about working alongside employees in the launch of KC1 and to innovate and build the omni channel fulfillment solutions of the future! We can't wait to see what she does in Kansas City!

#urbn #employeespotlight #supplychain

Nuuly President and URBN CTO, David Hayne joined industry colleagues at Shoptalk yesterday to discuss profitability and sustainability. 

"In order to be a sustainable business, you have to be a profitable business. We thought about both from the outset and are so excited about the incredible growth we have seen, as that growth supports both goals in tandem."

#shoptalk2023

For 50 years, we have built billion-dollar retail brands based on our success in curating content, product, and experiences. Our next chapter? Building a billion-dollar rental brand. 

Leveraging our history, expertise, and shared services, we're in a unique position to drive growth with Nuuly.

name: New Vista KY
summary: We see the good ahead.
description: New Vista is a non-profit community mental health center with 1,800 employees working at 55 program locations in 28 Kentucky counties. We serve the community with mental health, substance use, and intellectual and developmental disability services. New Vista offers a broad range of career opportunities, from an individual applying for their first job to an M.D. with years of clinical experience. New Vista is a community of individuals dedicated to providing services to children, adults, and families regardless of their ability to pay. We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to providing professional development and career advancement.
specialties: substance use, behavioral health, addiction treatment, intellectual and developmental disability services, IDD services, Human Services, Children's Mental Health Services, Adult Mental Health Services, Suicide Prevention, and Drug, Alcohol and Tobacco Prevention

posts.text: Join us Friday, May 5 for a Block Party at Greyline Station to kick off Mental Health Awareness Month. We'll have affirmation bracelet crafts, a positivity wall, games, food and more!

PROGRAM SPOTLIGHT: Lexington Drop-In Center.

We're so grateful for our community partners who help us provide resources to the people we serve. A big thank you to the Gratz Park Neighborhood Association for their recent donations.

PROGRAM SPOTLIGHT: The team at the Lexington Drop-In Center is here to connect you to the services you need. 

Showers, case management services, computer access and more are available weekdays at 201 Mechanic Street in downtown Lexington. Head to newvista.org/locations for more information.

In our latest blog, New Vista Employee Dylan Schell shares the story of how he administered Narcan to someone experiencing an overdose and gives his take on the recent approval of over-the-counter sales for the life-saving nasal spray. 

https://lnkd.in/e9GvXzXJ

New Vista Prevention is working with the Clark County Health Department to offer Youth Mental Health First Aid Training. 

To register, contact the Clark County Health Department at 859.744.1488 ext. 2012 or kayla.walton@cchdky.org. The cost is $25 but scholarships are available.

“The most interesting people you’ll find are ones that don’t fit into your average cardboard box. They’ll make what they need, they’ll make their own boxes.” — Dr. Temple Grandin

April marks World Autism Awareness Month! Communities around the world will come together in recognition and appreciation of people with autism and their loved ones. This month we'll share resources to support these extraordinary individuals. #autismawareness
We had a fantastic time with Women Leading KY at their Lunch With a Purpose last week and enjoyed the inspiring words of Fayette County Commonwealth's Attorney Kimberly Baird.

Happy National Puppy Day!
Studies show that dogs can reduce stress and anxiety, address depression, ease loneliness, and even encourage exercise, improving your all-around health (NAMI). Take a self-care break, snap and share a pic of your puppy (or used-to-be-puppy), and increase your well-being!

New Vista staff visited the Kentucky Castle this week to attend the 2023 presentation of the Jean Sabharwal Award to Melanie Tyner-Wilson, a longtime Kentuckian and lifelong advocate for the rights and supports of the intellectually and developmentally disabled communities. New Vista was honored to sponsor the event, a small gesture to show our eternal gratitude for Ms. Tyner-Wilson's advocacy and sacrifice. Her decades of passionate work are a vital part of what makes New Vista so effective in the treatment, case management, and support of Kentucky's most vulnerable children and their families.

Thank you, Melanie Tyner-Wilson, and congratulations!

Today is World Down Syndrome Day!  Today, along with Down Syndrome International, we raise awareness and educate the world about Down syndrome and the amazing people with Down syndrome that brighten our lives. New Vista cares and advocates for the entire intellectually and developmentally disabled community, but today is a special day to highlight our clients, their families, and providers that do all they can to improve the lives of the Down Syndrome community.  

Visit https://lnkd.in/gB7_Z53 to learn more about this year's theme, With Us Not For Us, which emphasizes the need to create change WITH the Down Syndrome community, not just FOR it.  #downsyndromeawareness #withusnotforus

name: Urban Outfitters

posts.text:
From concert signage to one-of-a-kind bags, UO brand marketing manager Liz McDonough showcases our commitment to creativity and circularity through vision, passion, and collaboration. Congrats to Liz and the entire team for making this vision a reality - just in time for Earth Month 🌍 👏 

Check out the limited collection at UO NY Herald Square and UO SF Union Square before they're gone!

ICYMI: in honor of Earth Month, we're celebrating a shared commitment to circularity and creative self expression with four one-of-a-kind Urban Renewal capsule collections from emerging vintage and handmade designers: Burger Babie, Birthday Girl, Different Bugs, and Tessa Fay. 

We sat down with the founders of these brands to learn more about their creative and responsible processes.

Learn more and shop their one-of-a-kind collections: https://lnkd.in/ea3HTabe
#earthday2023

"The energy at these events is magic - there’s something so special about creating campaigns + moments like these for our customers."  - Haley Williams, M.Ed.

Thanks to everyone who came out to meet Melanie Martinez and our amazing team for creating these memorable experiences for our customers 👏

New UO exclusives just dropped! Our latest capsule collection was created in partnership with the one-and-only Sean Wotherspoon, Round Two, and Nickelodeon featuring the iconic cartoon, Rocket Power. 

The full collection is available online today and select UO stores. Swing by one of 15 locations for a limited time AR experience that takes you surfing alongside the Rocket Power Kids and Sean, himself. (Pssst, there will be giveaways). 

Woogity! Woogity! Woogity!

Shop it before it’s gone and read more: https://lnkd.in/eUhp2MfA

Can't make it? The UO Exclusive Portals LP just dropped at urbanoutfitters.com - shop it here: https://lnkd.in/e4K5AQ2V

Our Spring campaign is here, where we embrace the season with a new state of mind. We celebrate escapism and self-discovery. We explore new worlds, feel the energy shift, and we see things from new perspectives - with good vibes only. ✌ 

Take a trip with Urban Outfitters. It’s the journey, not the destination. 

Credits to the talented and passionate team at UO: susan otto, Chris Worthington, Paul Hamann, Matt Wright, Victoria May, Ian Rousey, Maggie Dong, Meg C., Dana Rich, David DeVesa, Jacqueline Jensen, Cipriano De Haro, Catherine Clair Williams, Kelly Reilly, Kristina D., Alayna Giovannitti, and many more.

The UO exclusive Cheyney University x Mitchell and Ness collection has arrived: the first-ever collegiate merch collection for the nation’s first and oldest HBCU.

In celebration of their 186th Founders Day and Black History month, we’ve teamed up with Cheyney University of Pennsylvania and Mitchell & Ness Nostalgia Co. to design this collection of graphic t-shirts, loungewear, and accessories honoring the university’s history as being the “First Of It’s Kind”. The collection is now available to shop online exclusively at Urban Outfitters and 100% of the collection proceeds will be donated to Cheyney University.

Join us at the Cheyney University Student Union this Friday 24th from 11-3pm for a special on campus pop up to celebrate, shop the collection, and meet the URBN talent team. Hope to see you there!

Shop the collection and explore more: https://lnkd.in/eia9jspv

We're proud to announce our partnership with Creatives Want Change (CWC), a non-profit organization that provides young Black talent with access to education, mentoring and professional development beginning at the high school level to help create an effective pipeline for students into the fashion industry.  Together, we're committed to uplifting the next generation of creative youth.

Through their CWC Fellows program, Black high school students are sponsored to attend Pre-College Summer Programs in Fashion Design at the best design schools in the country, including Parsons School of Design, RISD, FIT, and SCAD. Students are invited to apply for the Summer 2023 session and will be matched by CWC with partner programs to help them explore an interest in Fashion.

Join us in supporting CWC with a donation at an Urban Outfitters store now through end of April. 

Learn more about CWC and information to apply to their Fellows program: https://lnkd.in/efZGqseH

This Black History Month, we're proud to celebrate the Black artists and advocates who move us and move our culture forward.  

We're kicking off the month with 7 capsule collections featured designs by artists Kehinde Wiley, Ron Bass, and Mia Lee, in addition to fashion brands PISHPOSH, Riveriswild, Electric Circle, and musician Oswin Benjamin. 

Join us for a first look at the assortment available during First Saturday at The Brooklyn Museum on February 4th and stay tuned for more updates and collection drops throughout the month! 

Learn more about the artists and explore our UO exclusive collections and collaborations: https://lnkd.in/eUQJJs86

name: The Vision Development Team
summary: A Sensory Focused Approach to Vision
description:
The Vision Development Team specializes in the treatment of vision problems of all ages.

Our full scope optometric practice dedicated to providing the highest quality vision care to children and adults in a friendly, comfortable, and professional atmosphere. Our cutting-edge practice incorporates optometric and occupational therapy principles that guide individuals to develop their vision and help them to achieve personal goals as well as to better function throughout their day. With a highly trained staff and state of the art equipment the Vision Development Team are leaders in the fields of vision therapy, neuro-optometric rehabilitation, sports vision and orthokeratology. The Vision Development Team takes you beyond 20/20!
specialties: Vision Therapy, Myopia Management, Neuro-Optometry, Sports Vision Training, Orthokeratology For Adults, and Braincore Neurofeedback

Known worldwide for her expertise in retained primitive reflexes, Patti Andrich MA, COVT, OTR/L has just released a new publication for the novice primitive reflex practitioner titled “Indicators of Primitive and Postural Reflexes Assessment.”

In her newest book, Andrich provides a repeatable testing and scoring system to measure physical and emotional responses to help practitioners learn what to look for when evaluating individuals. Adults as well as children, may be affected by retained primitive reflexes, which can cause issues in behavioral, emotional, academic, cognitive, motor coordination and sensory regulation. Her sensory Foundations program has helped hundreds of patients improve their quality of life.

This guide also gives you access to more than 30 videos demonstrating more than 25 procedures.

To pre-order your copy of "Indicators of Primitive and Postural Reflexes Assessment", click the link below: 

https://lnkd.in/gk8RgJRw

name: CoolSys - Refrigeration and HVAC Systems
description:
CoolSys is the parent of market-leading refrigeration & HVAC services companies, nationwide. Our companies provide a full spectrum of best-in-class service experiences and solutions for mission-critical refrigeration & HVAC systems in the retail, commercial, and industrial markets.  Through our team of over 1,000 highly-trained, self-performing service technicians across the country, we are proud to provide our customers with the following solutions, 24/7:
 
• Engineering & Design
• Installation of new systems and remodels
• Preventative maintenance
• Service & Repairs
• Energy Optimization Solutions
• Energy efficient refrigeration racks and systems
 
We are continually looking to expand the CoolSys family with refrigeration and/or HVAC companies that fit the following criteria:
 
• Proven track record of financial performance
•  A strong brand and market leadership position in the markets you serve
• Strong leadership and management team
• Strong customer relationships
• A culture that values the importance of each and every employee
 
Interested in joining the CoolSys family?  To learn more about the benefits of joining our fast-growing, market-leading, national refrigeration & HVAC organization, visit our website: www.CoolSys.com.

name: Find Great People | FGP
summary: A Forbes nationally recognized talent acquisition and human resources consulting firm.
description:
Find Great People (FGP) is a nationally recognized talent acquisition and human resources consulting firm. We’re known especially for two things: purposeful growth and abundant gratitude. 

Honored as one of America’s Best Recruitment Firms by Forbes, being better today than yesterday drives us forward. Over nearly four decades, FGP services have evolved to include direct hire search, executive search, temporary staffing, contract staffing, consulting and outplacement. Specialty areas include accounting and finance, engineering, executive, healthcare, human resources, manufacturing, nonprofit, public sector, sales and marketing and technology. 

We are headquartered in Greenville, SC, with offices in Columbia, SC and Nashville, TN. A Veteran Owned Small Business, FGP values and supports the Veteran community. www.fgp.com
specialties: Professional Staffing, Recruiting, Human Resources, Technology, Healthcare, Executive Search, Direct Hire Search, Temporary Talent, Human Resources Consulting, and Outplacement Services

name: University of Denver
summary: The University of Denver is a private university dedicated to the public good, located in Denver, Colorado.
description:
Founded in 1864 — just a few years after the city of Denver itself was founded—the University of Denver is one of the country's premier private universities. The University's 125-acre campus, a few miles south of downtown Denver, is home to about 12,000 students hailing from all regions of the United States and 83 other countries. The University offers more than 100 undergraduate programs of study and more than 120 graduate and professional programs. DU is recognized as a Doctoral/Very High Research University (or “R1”) by the Carnegie Classification of Institutions of Higher Education. 
 
The University of Denver may delete posts or comments that promote for-profit ventures that do not comply with DU policies. Posts that are grossly off-topic, abusive, contain profanity, pornography, are threatening, contain discriminatory language or language of bias or hate, and the like will not be tolerated. This page is moderated by DU staff to maintain safety and ensure appropriate interactions. Posts concerning safety and discrimination will be brought to the immediate attention of Campus Safety and/or Office of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion.
specialties: Business, Law, Sciences, International Studies, Economics, and Management

posts.text: Snow always looks good on the DU campus!

DU’s Colorado Evaluation and Action Lab works to help address longstanding inequities within the prosecutorial system. 

The Colorado Lab issued a series of reports analyzing racial and ethnic disparities in prosecution. They looked at four major decision points: whether the case was accepted or declined; whether it was dismissed or concluded with a guilty plea or deferred judgment; whether the charge was reduced; and whether the case closed with a sentence to incarceration.”
 
https://bit.ly/3Nb944n

The University of Denver honored and celebrated its founding by acquiring the James C. Kennedy Mountain Campus. The 724-acre Kenndey Mountain Campus enhances the 4D Experience for students by giving students space to explore a city and mountain education. 
Read more about the celebration here: 
University of Denver - Daniels College of Business
#KMC #KennedyMountainCampus

DU students are impacting their communities. Alumni and current students of the Graduate School of Social Work are taking their skills and training to the people who need it the most, through a partnership with Project Angel Heart. With the support of 8,000 volunteers, this nonprofit organization packages and delivers medically tailored meals to people with severe illnesses.  Together, Project Angel Heart and DU’s Graduate School of Social Work are making a difference with the belief that food is medicine.
Our Community. Our Planet. Happy Earth Day!

Eid al-Fitr, or the Festival of Fast-Breaking, marks the end of Ramadan, the Muslim holy month of fasting. For everyone who is celebrating the end of Ramadan, we wish you a joyous and reverent end to your fast!

Natalie Impraim, a master's student in the International Human Rights Programs at DU's Korbel School of International Studies, describes her research on gender equity and women's empowerment for women in leadership roles. She and her husband started a nonprofit organization in Africa to give children access to resources and empowerment through sports and the arts.
